Jink.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction but reduces the accuracy. Cannot be used if the unit has attacked this turn.
Jink.flavor: Some units favour speed and agility rather than heavy armour to keep them alive on the battlefield, dodging and weaving unscathed through hails of incoming fire.
Jink.rawXML:
<jink consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" cooldown="3">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<notAttackedThisTurn/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Jink"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</jink>
Jink.name: Jink

Command Uplink.description: Reduces the morale loss of this unit and adjacent allied Adeptus Mechanicus units.
Command Uplink.flavor:
“You may feel fear, you may want to flee; but when your Magos can, with a thought, stop your limbs taking a single step back, well, then you fight anyway.”
—Marshal Diktum
Command Uplink.name: Command Uplink

Found City.description:
Consumes the unit to found a new city.

Cities can only be found where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by %2%.
Found City.name: Found City

Clear Tile.description: Restores the tile to its normal state and clears it of wire weed, holy sites, imperial ruins and forests, one at a time.
Clear Tile.name: Clear Tile

Master of Machines.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied Adeptus Mechanicus, vehicle or fortification unit.
Master of Machines.flavor:
“Our enemies may rest but rust never sleeps.”
—Tech-Priest Jung, Forge World Gehenna
Master of Machines.rawXML:
<masterOfMachines cooldown="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/MasterOfMachines">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMin="1" rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<faction name="AdeptusMechanicus"/>
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</masterOfMachines>
Master of Machines.name: Master of Machines

Reprogram Kastelan Robot.description: Takes control of the target enemy Kastelan Robot.
Reprogram Kastelan Robot.flavor: Since the aftermath of Warmaster Horus’ rebellion the Legio Cybernetica’s robots have been controlled completely by their masters – not by the bio-plastic cerebra and nerve-like tendril webs of Mechanicum constructs, but by sanctified doctrina wafers. No bigger than the cards of the Emperor’s Tarot, these slivers of wetware are entrusted to the Cybernetica Datasmiths that accompany the robot maniples to war. Inserted into the dataslot hidden behind each robot’s chestplate, the wafer’s command protocol will dictate every iota of the host’s behaviour, usually optimising its ability to destroy its foes in a spectacular fashion.
Reprogram Kastelan Robot.rawXML:
<reprogramKastelanRobot cooldown="10" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ReprogramKastelanRobot">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<player>
							<noFaction name="Neutral"/>
						</player>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<type name="Neutral/KastelanRobot"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<changePlayer/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</reprogramKastelanRobot>
Reprogram Kastelan Robot.name: Reprogram Kastelan Robot

Hammer of Wrath.description: Increases the damage of non-Bomb weapons.
Hammer of Wrath.flavor: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.
Hammer of Wrath.rawXML:
<hammerOfWrath consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/HammerOfWrath">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="HammerOfWrath" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</hammerOfWrath>
Hammer of Wrath.name: Hammer of Wrath

Set Rally Point.description: Sets the rally point for newly produced units in this city.
Set Rally Point.name: Set Rally Point

Broad Spectrum Data-Tether.description: Reduces the morale loss of this unit and adjacent allied Adeptus Mechanicus units.
Broad Spectrum Data-Tether.flavor: A vehicle-mounted version of that carried by veteran Skitarii, the broad spectrum data-tether projects a Tech-Priest’s binharic blurts with such clarity it seems he is amongst the ranks of the Skitarii himself. Imperatives delivered via such information relays are more potent and reliable than any other.
Broad Spectrum Data-Tether.name: Broad Spectrum Data-Tether

Aura of Fear.description: Reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units each turn.
Aura of Fear.flavor: Some beings are so monstrous or alien that they can force their foes to recoil in horror.
Aura of Fear.name: Aura of Fear

Jump Pack.description: Flies across obstacles to the target tile.
Jump Pack.flavor: A jump pack enables the wearer to make bounding leaps across the battlefield and make boosted flights over short distances or to the tops of fortress walls.
Jump Pack.rawXML:
<jumpPack cooldown="3">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<movement add="1"/>
						<movementMax add="1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/HammerOfWrath">
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="HammerOfWrath"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</jumpPack>
Jump Pack.name: Jump Pack

Rad-Saturation.description: Damages adjacent enemy infantry and monstrous creature units each turn.
Rad-Saturation.flavor: Harnessing the destructive energies of forge worlds within their weaponry, certain Skitarii are so soaked in radiation that even to approach them is to confer a death sentence upon yourself. Victory for them is pyrrhic, as this radiation burns through even their heavy armour plate, slowly poisoning them to death even as their carbines bring about the (much quicker) demise of their enemies.
Rad-Saturation.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="AdeptusMechanicus/RadSaturation" passive="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" excludeRadius="0" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="AdeptusMechanicus/RadSaturation"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Rad-Saturation.name: Rad-Saturation

Voices in the Code.description: Increases the morale loss of adjacent enemy units.
Voices in the Code.flavor: Closing with a Sicarian Infiltrator is a mistake—their augmented craniums broadcast a brutally disruptive audiovisual assault, causing enemies to fall deafened and blinded; battles are often decided before even a single kill is confirmed.
Voices in the Code.name: Voices in the Code

Control Edict.description: Removes Doctrina Imperatives malus from allied infantry units in range.
Control Edict.flavor: A Doctrina Imperative is hardly a subtle tool, disabling a soldier just as much as it enables them elsewhere. Yet, the attentions of an experienced Marshal can aid in overcoming the Imperative’s cruder commands, enabling the soldier to perform far above their nominal norms.
Control Edict.rawXML:
<controlEdict cooldown="2" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ControlEdict" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radiusMin="1" radiusMax="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="AdeptusMechanicus"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ControlEdict"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</controlEdict>
Control Edict.name: Control Edict

Aggression Override.description: Increases the attacks of target allied Adeptus Mechanicus infantry unit.
Aggression Override.flavor: Employing data-refined kill-canticle protocols, the Marshal ensures his Skitarii are driven into a state of heightened ferocity that sees their bloodstreams boil with combat hyperstimulants.
Aggression Override.rawXML:
<aggressionOverride cooldown="2" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="AdeptusMechanicus/AggressionOverride" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="AdeptusMechanicus"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/AggressionOverride"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</aggressionOverride>
Aggression Override.name: Aggression Override

Servo-Skull Uplink.description: Increases the damage of allied Adeptus Mechanicus infantry units in range.
Servo-Skull Uplink.flavor: It is a great honour for a pious Imperial servant or tech-adept to be converted into a servo skull after death—to have their skull augmented with anti-grav and a rudimentary machine intelligence. Optically-augmented servo skulls like those possessed by a Skitarii Marshal are useful for reconnaissance and targeting, hugely reducing the chance of wasted shots.
Servo-Skull Uplink.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="AdeptusMechanicus/ServoSkullUplink" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radiusMin="1" radiusMax="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="AdeptusMechanicus/ServoSkullUplink"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Servo-Skull Uplink.name: Servo-Skull Uplink

Enriched Rounds.description: Increases the damage of target allied Adeptus Mechanicus infantry unit.
Enriched Rounds.flavor: Sanctified with the Tri-fold Litany, each of these slugs has spent a decade in the oldest and most irradiated forge temple to certify their lethality. When the Marshal hands them out to his maniples, they know they must make every shot count.
Enriched Rounds.rawXML:
<enrichedRounds cooldown="2" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/EnrichedRounds" rank="-1" rankMax="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="AdeptusMechanicus"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/EnrichedRounds"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</enrichedRounds>
Enriched Rounds.name: Enriched Rounds

Shop.description: Buys and sells items for influence. Available at the Jokaero Trader Encampment.
Shop.name: Shop

Scryerskull.description: Reveals the target tile and adjacent tiles.
Scryerskull.flavor: The Adeptus Mechanicus take the assessment and exploitation of battlefield resources very seriously indeed – so much so that many of them continue their work in this role beyond the point of death.
Scryerskull.rawXML:
<scryerskull cooldownMin="3" cooldownMax="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/Scryerskull" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1" sighted="0">
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<reveal/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</scryerskull>
Scryerskull.name: Scryerskull

Lord of the Machine Cult.description: Increases the accuracy of adjacent Adeptus Mechanicus vehicle units.
Lord of the Machine Cult.flavor:
“You may say, it is impossible for a man to become like the Machine. And I would reply, that only the smallest mind strives to comprehend its limits.”
—Fabricator General Kane
Lord of the Machine Cult.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="AdeptusMechanicus/LordOfTheMachineCult" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="AdeptusMechanicus/LordOfTheMachineCult"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Lord of the Machine Cult.name: Lord of the Machine Cult

Wrath of Mars.description: Increases the damage of the Tech-Priest Dominus.
Wrath of Mars.flavor: None can smite the blasphemer like those from Mars, for theirs is the most righteous of zeal. All praise the glory of the Machine God!
Wrath of Mars.rawXML:
<wrathOfMars cooldown="3" name="AdeptusMechanicus/WrathOfMars" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="AdeptusMechanicus/WrathOfMars" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</wrathOfMars>
Wrath of Mars.name: Wrath of Mars

Mechanicus Locum.description: Increases the influence and research output.
Mechanicus Locum.flavor: Every congregation of Tech-Priests comprises masters of arcane knowledge—zealous leaders of man and machine.
Mechanicus Locum.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/MechanicusLocum" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="AdeptusMechanicus/MechanicusLocum"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Mechanicus Locum.name: Mechanicus Locum

Tech-Adept.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied Adeptus Mechanicus, vehicle or fortification unit.
Tech-Adept.flavor: Repairing war engines damaged in the crusade is a holy task.
Tech-Adept.rawXML:
<techAdept cooldown="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/TechAdept" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMin="1" rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<faction name="AdeptusMechanicus"/>
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="12" addMax="24"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</techAdept>
Tech-Adept.name: Tech-Adept

Galvanic Field.description: Increases the armour penetration of target allied Adeptus Mechanicus unit.
Galvanic Field.flavor: Using the Motive Force contained within a large galvanic cell, the Manipulus’s electropositors can infuse the weaponry of nearby allies with the underlying current of all life, carrying the Omnissiah sacred benedictions forward to cast all heretics down.
Galvanic Field.rawXML:
<galvanicField cooldown="3" name="AdeptusMechanicus/GalvanicField" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="AdeptusMechanicus"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="AdeptusMechanicus/GalvanicField"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</galvanicField>
Galvanic Field.name: Galvanic Field

Electro-Shocked.description: Stuns target enemy infantry or monstrous creature.
Electro-Shocked.flavor: The truly devout can send a sudden charge of the Motive Force pulsing through their numerous augmentations, stunning nearby foes.
Electro-Shocked.rawXML:
<electroShocked cooldownMax="1" cooldownMin="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ElectroShocked" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<noTrait name="Stunned"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Stunned"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</electroShocked>
Electro-Shocked.name: Electro-Shocked

Data-Blessed Autosermon.description: Canticles of the Omnissiah units in the area grant research when killing enemies.
Data-Blessed Autosermon.flavor: Struck with an infoload of revelation, truly blessed Tech-Priests will override the sacred canticles to deliver the Machine God’s adaptive wisdom.
Data-Blessed Autosermon.rawXML:
<dataBlessedAutosermon cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/DataBlessedAutosermon" rank="-1" rankMax="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/CanticlesOfTheOmnissiah"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/DataBlessedAutosermon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</dataBlessedAutosermon>
Data-Blessed Autosermon.name: Data-Blessed Autosermon

Create Smoke Screen.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of the tile.
Create Smoke Screen.flavor: Some vehicles have small launchers mounted onto them that carry smoke canisters. These are used to temporarily obscure the vehicle behind billowing clouds of smoke, allowing it to cross open areas in greater safety—although it does so at the cost of being able to fire its own weapons.
Create Smoke Screen.name: Create Smoke Screen

Medi-Pack.flavor: Medi-packs contain all the necessary drugs, dressings and surgical tools to get a wounded Imperial Guardsman back in the fight, or save the lives of vital personnel.
Medi-Pack.name: Medi-Pack

Aura of Discipline.description: Increases the accuracy of the Lord Commissar and adjacent allied Astra Militarum infantry.
Aura of Discipline.flavor: Should discipline or morale falter, it is the task of the Commissar to take whatever steps necessary to restore order, and to do so in the absolute knowledge that his actions are just. Under the steely gaze of such a man, Imperial Guardsmen must be inspired to deeds they never believed possible.
Aura of Discipline.rawXML:
<auraOfDiscipline passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" levelUpPriority="0.1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Discipline"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</auraOfDiscipline>
Aura of Discipline.name: Aura of Discipline

\u201cBring it Down!\u201d.description: Increases the armour penetration of the Lord Commissar and adjacent allied Astra Militarum infantry.
\u201cBring it Down!\u201d.flavor: Enemy war machines and alien monstrosities are equally high priority targets for the commanders of the Imperial Guard.
\u201cBring it Down!\u201d.rawXML:
<bringItDown cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" shoutString="Actions/BringItDown">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="AstraMilitarum"/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="BringItDown"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</bringItDown>
\u201cBring it Down!\u201d.name: “Bring it Down!”

Summary Execution.description: Executes a squad member of an adjacent infantry unit to restore morale of nearby allied units.
Summary Execution.flavor: In extremis, a Commissar must be prepared to execute wavering soldiers or incompetent officers without a moment's remorse; few things enforce discipline better than a malcontent or coward being shot dead for their failings, and this message is all the stronger when a mass-reactive bolt shell sprays a Guardsman's brains across his horrified comrades in a shower of gore.
Summary Execution.rawXML:
<summaryExecution cooldown="3" rank="-1" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1" rangeMin="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<groupSize add="-1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="3" addMax="9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>			
		</summaryExecution>
Summary Execution.name: Summary Execution

Iron Will.description: After dying, the Lord Commissar immediately comes back to life.
Iron Will.flavor:
“Pain is temporary, Honour is forever.”
  — Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only
Iron Will.rawXML:
<ironWill beginOnDisappear="1" cooldown="10" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="IronWill"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<destroyed/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="1.0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</ironWill>
Iron Will.name: Iron Will

Dispense Chaff.flavor: Since the earliest days of airborne combat, some form of lightweight material has been used to distract enemy pilots. Today's chaff would be unrecognizable to those early airmen, but its efficacy against modern countermeasures is about the same.
Dispense Chaff.rawXML:
<dispenseChaff consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" cooldown="5" requiredUpgrade="AstraMilitarum/ChaffLauncher">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Chaff"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</dispenseChaff>
Dispense Chaff.name: Dispense Chaff

Scrier's Gaze.description: Reveals the target tile and adjacent tiles.
Scrier's Gaze.flavor: The diviner can see the battlefield clearly in the mind's eye, with the vantage point of a hunting hawk and the precision of a laser. The to and fro of armies and war machines is but the scurrying of ants beneath his omniscient gaze. Thus can the diviner direct the deployment of specialist forces exactly when and where they are most needed, directing them to vital objectives that, once secured, will ensure victory.
Scrier's Gaze.rawXML:
<sciersGaze cooldownMin="3" cooldownMax="1" psychicPower="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1" sighted="0">
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<reveal/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</sciersGaze>
Scrier's Gaze.name: Scrier's Gaze

Scout.description: Reveals all tiles in the area.
Scout.rawXML:
<scout consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<reveal/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</scout>
Scout.name: Scout

\u201cFull Throttle!\u201d.description: Grants movement to the Tank Commander and adjacent allied tanks with movement remaining.
\u201cFull Throttle!\u201d.flavor: The officer leads a glorious tank charge that grinds the enemy beneath his treads.
\u201cFull Throttle!\u201d.rawXML:
<fullThrottle cooldown="3" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" shoutString="Actions/FullThrottle">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<movement greater="0"/>
											<trait name="Tank"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="FullThrottle"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</fullThrottle>
\u201cFull Throttle!\u201d.name: “Full Throttle!”

\u201cGunners, Kill on Sight!\u201d.description: Increases the ranged attacks of the Tank Commander and adjacent allied tanks.
\u201cGunners, Kill on Sight!\u201d.flavor: The officer gives his men free rein to unleash discretionary fire.
\u201cGunners, Kill on Sight!\u201d.rawXML:
<gunnersKillOnSight cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.15" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" shoutString="Actions/GunnersKillOnSight">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<trait name="Tank"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="GunnersKillOnSight"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</gunnersKillOnSight>
\u201cGunners, Kill on Sight!\u201d.name: “Gunners, Kill on Sight!”

\u201cRoll Over Them!\u201d.flavor: When all else fails, gravity and the immense weight of a vehicle can crush otherwise impenetrable defenses—or stalwart opponents.
\u201cRoll Over Them!\u201d.rawXML:
<rollOverThem cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" shoutString="Actions/RollOverThem" weaponSlotName="RollOverThem">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<damage mulMin="0.0" mulMax="1.0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</rollOverThem>
\u201cRoll Over Them!\u201d.name: “Roll Over Them!”

\u201cStrike and Shroud!\u201d.description: Creates a smoke screen on the tile of the Tank Commander and adjacent tiles with allied tanks that provides ranged damage reduction.
\u201cStrike and Shroud!\u201d.rawXML:
<strikeAndShroud cooldownMin="5" cooldownMax="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" shoutString="Actions/StrikeAndShroud">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<trait name="Tank"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addFeature duration="3" name="SmokeScreen"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</strikeAndShroud>
\u201cStrike and Shroud!\u201d.name: “Strike and Shroud!”

Blessings of the Omnissiah.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.
Blessings of the Omnissiah.flavor:
“Thus do we invoke the Machine God.
Thus do we make whole that which was sundered.”
  — Hymn of reforging
Blessings of the Omnissiah.rawXML:
<blessingsOfTheOmnissiah cooldown="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</blessingsOfTheOmnissiah>
Blessings of the Omnissiah.name: Blessings of the Omnissiah

Awaken The Machine.description: Increases the ranged accuracy of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.
Awaken The Machine.flavor:
“With push of Button fire the Engine
And spark Turbine into life…
Toll the Great Bell Thrice!
Sing Praise to the
God of All Machines”
  — Catechism of the Autoculus of Mars
modifiers: Power of the Machine Spirit (5 turns)
Awaken The Machine.rawXML:
<awakenTheMachine cooldown="5" requiredUpgrade="AstraMilitarum/AwakenTheMachine">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<noTrait name="PowerOfTheMachineSpirit"/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="5" name="PowerOfTheMachineSpirit"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</awakenTheMachine>
Awaken The Machine.name: Awaken The Machine

Construct Imperial Bastion.description: Fortification with heavy bolters that can shelter infantry.
Construct Imperial Bastion.flavor: An Imperial Bastion is an imposing edifice built from foot-thick ferrocrete and the remains of faithful servants of the Imperium. As they are relatively easy to construct, some planets boast networks of Bastions that span entire continents. Built to withstand orbital strikes and artillery bombardments, there are few weapons capable of razing them in a single blow. It is with good reason that such fortresses often form the cornerstone of a planet's defensive strategy.
Construct Imperial Bastion.rawXML:
<constructImperialStrongpoint icon="Units/AstraMilitarum/ImperialStrongpoint" requiredUpgrade="AstraMilitarum/ImperialStrongpoint" cooldown="10">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<oreCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Resource"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="AstraMilitarum/ImperialStrongpoint"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</constructImperialStrongpoint>
Construct Imperial Bastion.name: Construct Imperial Bastion

Construct Void Shield Generator.description: Fortification that shields units in range.
Construct Void Shield Generator.flavor: Void shields are normally localised force fields reserved for protecting the monolithic Titans of the Adeptus Mechanicus, but static generators can be erected to serve as an aegis for other targets of vital import. The largest Void Shield generators can even project an invisible bubble of power across a large area of the battlefield, sheltering both troops and strategically vital battlefield locations by absorbing or deflecting the energy of incoming munitions.
Construct Void Shield Generator.rawXML:
<constructVoidShieldGenerator icon="Units/AstraMilitarum/VoidShieldGenerator" requiredUpgrade="AstraMilitarum/VoidShieldGenerator" cooldown="10">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<energyCost base="20"/>
						<oreCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Resource"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="AstraMilitarum/VoidShieldGenerator"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</constructVoidShieldGenerator>
Construct Void Shield Generator.name: Construct Void Shield Generator

Supersonic.flavor: Supersonic vehicles are supremely fast, even by the normal standards of aircraft, making them exceptionally mobile in battle.
Supersonic.name: Supersonic

Projected Void Shield.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of units in range.
Projected Void Shield.flavor: The Void Shield is the peak Imperial ranged-defense technology and is normally only mounted on Titans and Superheavy Tanks because of its immense power needs. This variant uses the technology to defend a wide area, though it is useless against melee attacks.
Projected Void Shield.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility icon="Traits/VoidShield" cooldownRemaining="1" name="AstraMilitarum/ProjectedVoidShield" passive="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="2">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="VoidShield"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Projected Void Shield.name: Projected Void Shield

Enfeeble.description: Reduces the damage and movement of the target enemy unit.
Enfeeble.flavor: As the psyker channels his powers, tendrils of Warp energy lash over his victims, every caress sapping strength and vitality from their bodies.
Enfeeble.rawXML:
<enfeeble cooldown="1" psychicPower="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Weakened"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Weakened"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</enfeeble>
Enfeeble.name: Enfeeble

Misfortune.description: Increases the damage taken for the target enemy unit.
Misfortune.flavor: With a click of his fingers, the diviner twists fate so that his followers' blows punch through the weakest points in their opponent's armour.
Misfortune.rawXML:
<misfortune cooldown="1" psychicPower="1" requiredUpgrade="AstraMilitarum/Misfortune">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Misfortune"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Misfortune"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</misfortune>
Misfortune.name: Misfortune

Cultist Sacrifice.description: Increases the growth rate of target allied Chaos Space Marines city by sacrificing the unit.
Cultist Sacrifice.flavor: So fervent are the cultists of Chaos but so weak their martial prowess, that the gods enjoy their demise as much as their life—more so, perhaps, given the blessings they bestow at their sacrifice.
Cultist Sacrifice.rawXML:
<cultistSacrifice name="ChaosSpaceMarines/CultistSacrifice">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Headquarters"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="City">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/CultistSacrifice" duration="10"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
			<endTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<removeUnit/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</endTargets>
		</cultistSacrifice>
Cultist Sacrifice.name: Cultist Sacrifice

Construct Noctilith Crown.description: Fortification that shields allied Chaos units and damages enemy psykers.
Construct Noctilith Crown.flavor: Noctilith Crowns form vital strongpoints, for these arcane devices can draw in the raw energy of Chaos itself.
Construct Noctilith Crown.rawXML:
<constructNoctilithCrown icon="Units/ChaosSpaceMarines/NoctilithCrown" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/NoctilithCrown" cooldown="10">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<energyCost base="20"/>
						<oreCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Resource"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="ChaosSpaceMarines/NoctilithCrown"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</constructNoctilithCrown>
Construct Noctilith Crown.name: Construct Noctilith Crown

Dirge Caster.description: Prevents adjacent enemy units from doing overwatch attacks.
Dirge Caster.flavor: This device emits a series of terrifying wails, screams and howls that demoralise and confuse enemies who hear them.
Dirge Caster.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="ChaosSpaceMarines/DirgeCaster" passive="1" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/DirgeCaster">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" excludeRadius="0" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/DirgeCaster"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Dirge Caster.name: Dirge Caster

Ichor Blood.description: Enemies take damage when they cause melee damage.
Ichor Blood.flavor: It is not blood that runs through this champion's veins, but searing ichor, molten brass, psychadelic narcotics, virulent pus or some such vile and deadly substance.
Ichor Blood.rawXML:
<ichorBlood cooldown="2" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IchorBlood" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IchorBlood" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</ichorBlood>
Ichor Blood.name: Ichor Blood

Worthy Offering.description: Increases the chance that this unit and adjacent allied Champions of Chaos receive a Boon of Chaos.
Worthy Offering.flavor: Having the eye of the gods upon you means those nearby are also subject to greater scrutiny—whether that turns them to Spawn or Daemon Prince, depends on how well they perform and the inscrutable whim of the Gods.
Worthy Offering.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="ChaosSpaceMarines/WorthyOffering" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/WorthyOffering"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Worthy Offering.name: Worthy Offering

Dark Glory.flavor: Some champions of Chaos are so blessed by their patron deity that they are supernaturally protected from harm. They might be surrounded by a powerful, crackling shield of energy, or else bullets aimed at them may be strangely turned aside just before they strike. In either case, it is clear that the Dark Gods are watching over them.
Dark Glory.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="ChaosSpaceMarines/DarkGlory" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/DarkGlory"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Dark Glory.name: Dark Glory

Exalted Strike.description: Performs a devastating Thunder Hammer attack against the target enemy unit with less than 50% hitpoints.
Exalted Strike.flavor: To face a Chaos Lord in battle isn’t just to face an elite Adeptus Astartes, or a veteran of ten thousand years of war—it’s to face the best of those few survivors, one also blessed by the gods. After ten millennia, they well know weakness and how to exploit it.
Exalted Strike.rawXML:
<exaltedStrike cooldown="3" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/ExaltedStrike" rank="-1" rankMax="0" weaponSlotName="ThunderHammer">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<accuracy mul="1.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<hitpointsFraction less="0.5"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</exaltedStrike>
Exalted Strike.name: Exalted Strike

Self-Repair.flavor: The machine spirits of the Traitor Legions’ vehicles have long been driven to despair or corrupted by demons, but the surviving vehicles have gained something for that lost—a crude regeneration that stitches the unholy metal back together, so they can continue the work of the Dark Gods.
Self-Repair.name: Self-Repair

Prince of Chaos.description: Increases the accuracy of this unit and adjacent allied Chaos units.
Prince of Chaos.flavor: Little else could more inspire a warrior of Chaos than to see a Daemon Prince—once a mortal just like them, now nearer to a God—fighting alongside them.
Prince of Chaos.name: Prince of Chaos

Boon of Mutation.description: Target adjacent allied Champion of Chaos unit gains a missing, unlocked Boon of Chaos.
Boon of Mutation.flavor: The psyker lays his hands upon a warrior marked for glory, channeling the warping power of Chaos into his body until his flesh wrenches and flows.
Boon of Mutation.rawXML:
<boonOfMutation cooldownMin="4" cooldownMax="2" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/BoonOfMutation" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/ChampionOfChaos"/>
							<missingBoonOfChaos/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addRandomBoonOfChaos/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</boonOfMutation>
Boon of Mutation.name: Boon of Mutation

Gift of Contagion.description: Deals damage to the target enemy infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Gift of Contagion.flavor: The psyker gathers clouds of contagion and rot-flies about his enemies, granting them Father Nurgle's blessing.
Gift of Contagion.rawXML:
<giftOfContagion cooldown="3" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/GiftOfContagion" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Blighted"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Blighted" durationMin="1" durationMax="3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</giftOfContagion>
Gift of Contagion.name: Gift of Contagion

Deferred Absolution.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction of adjacent allied Chaos units.
Deferred Absolution.flavor: The bowed figures of the Dark Disciples incessantly shriek the names of the Chaos Gods, calling for their protection. Typically fickle, the Gods are prone to bless those nearby instead, leaving the desperate Disciples as frail as ever.
Deferred Absolution.name: Deferred Absolution

Daemonforge.description: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the damage and armour penetration.
Daemonforge.flavor: The Daemon Engines of the Chaos Space Marines are driven by a fathomless hatred born of the warp.
Daemonforge.rawXML:
<daemonforge consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Daemonforge">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="-0.1"/>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Daemonforge" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</daemonforge>
Daemonforge.name: Daemonforge

Sacrifice.description: Lose hitpoints to restore the hitpoints of the target allied unit.
Sacrifice.flavor: The psyker uses a sacrificial soul to remould and repair an unholy Daemon-form. The tainted spirits of Warpsmiths are particularly invigorating offerings to those Daemon Engines that are in their charge.
Sacrifice.rawXML:
<sacrifice cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Sacrifice" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMin="1" rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="6" addMax="18"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="-2"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</sacrifice>
Sacrifice.name: Sacrifice

Infernal Power.description: Increases the accuracy and damage of this unit and adjacent allied Chaos units.
Infernal Power.flavor: The fell power of the immaterium flows from the psyker, imbuing the Daemons that reside within his followers' bodies with even greater ferocity.
Infernal Power.rawXML:
<infernalPower cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalPower" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalPower"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</infernalPower>
Infernal Power.name: Infernal Power

Possession.description: Killing enemy units transforms them into allied Chaos Spawns.
Possession.flavor: The psyker blasts away their enemy's soul so that the spiritless shell left behind can be possessed by a Daemon, who quickly transforms it into a more pleasing form.
Possession.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility cooldownMin="5" cooldownMax="1" disableable="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Possession" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Possession"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Possession.name: Possession

Incursion.flavor: The psyker opens a portal to the Realm of Chaos, allowing the warp's daemonic denizens to spill forth into reality.
Incursion.rawXML:
<incursion cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Incursion" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/ReservoirOfDaemonicEnergy"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<randomEffects count="1">
										<addUnit name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Heldrake" consumedAction="0" consumedMovement="0"/>
										<addUnit name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Maulerfiend" consumedAction="0" consumedMovement="0"/>
										<addUnit name="ChaosSpaceMarines/WarpTalon" consumedAction="0" consumedMovement="0"/>
									</randomEffects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Summon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</incursion>
Incursion.name: Incursion

Lasher Tendrils.description: Decreases the melee attacks of adjacent enemy units.
Lasher Tendrils.flavor: These metallic tendrils entrap their prey in an iron grip.
Lasher Tendrils.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="ChaosSpaceMarines/LasherTendrils" passive="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" excludeRadius="0" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/LasherTendrils"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Lasher Tendrils.name: Lasher Tendrils

Loathsome Aura.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction of adjacent allied Chaos units.
Loathsome Aura.flavor: A brutal edifice, raised up to destabilise local reality by the forces of Chaos, the Noctilith Crown brings the Warp closer, empowering those attuned to the Dark Gods.
Loathsome Aura.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="ChaosSpaceMarines/LoathsomeAura" passive="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/LoathsomeAura"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Loathsome Aura.name: Loathsome Aura

Malevolent Locus.description: Damages enemy non-Chaos psykers in range each turn.
Malevolent Locus.flavor: By this twisted construct, the whispers of the Warp are amplified, assaulting the minds of enemy psykers constantly. Few emerge unscathed from the trial.
Malevolent Locus.name: Malevolent Locus

Cycle Weapon After Use.description: Automatically cycles active weapon after usage.
Cycle Weapon After Use.name: Cycle Weapon After Use

Reservoir of Daemonic Energy.description: Reduces the cooldown of Incursion for adjacent allied Masters of Possesion.
Reservoir of Daemonic Energy.flavor: Venomcrawlers are uniquely valued both off and on the battlefield. Not only can their repositories of stored warp energy be siphoned in order to create fresh Daemon Engines, but they can be used in the thick of combat to weaken the fabric of reality. Masters of Possession are particularly adept at drawing upon this reservoir to lure the daemonic servants of the Chaos Gods into existence. At battle's end these Daemons are hastily consumed by the Venomcrawler, their essences used to replenish its depleted warp stores.
Reservoir of Daemonic Energy.name: Reservoir of Daemonic Energy

Warpflame Strike.description: Flies across obstacles to the target tile and blinds adjacent enemy infantry and monstrous creatures.
Warpflame Strike.flavor: Though the lesion they slice in the fabric of realspace seals over as soon as the hunting pack has passed through, the mind-shattering nature of their attack is usually enough to stun their prey into inactivity. This moment of awestruck hesitation is often fatal, for the hellishly sharp claws of the Warp Talons part heads from necks and limbs from torsos as the hunters hurtle into the ranks of the foe.
Warpflame Strike.rawXML:
<jumpPack name="ChaosSpaceMarines/WarpflameStrike" cooldown="3">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<movement add="1"/>
						<movementMax add="1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/HammerOfWrath">
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="HammerOfWrath"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
			<endTargets>
				<target>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Blind"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</endTargets>
		</jumpPack>
Warpflame Strike.name: Warpflame Strike

Master of Mechanisms.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.
Master of Mechanisms.flavor: Despite their array of weaponry, only a Khornate fool would put a Warpsmith directly into battle, when he or she could be better placed repairing and rebinding their Daemon Engine charges.
Master of Mechanisms.rawXML:
<masterOfMechanisms cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MasterOfMechanisms" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMin="1" rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="8" addMax="24"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</masterOfMechanisms>
Master of Mechanisms.name: Master of Mechanisms

Shatter Defences.description: Reduces the ranged damage reduction of the target tile.
Shatter Defences.flavor: Whatever cover the enemy cowers behind, a Warpsmith can draw upon millennia of siege experience to advise on the best way to bypass or to destroy them.
Shatter Defences.rawXML:
<shatterDefences cooldownMin="3" cooldownMax="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/ShatterDefences" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addFeature name="ShatterDefences" duration="3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</shatterDefences>
Shatter Defences.name: Shatter Defences

Mechatendrils.flavor: Reminiscent of the servo-harness worn by the Techmarines of the Adeptus Astrates, these writhing tentacles are worn by—or even implanted into—Chaos Warpsmiths.
Mechatendrils.rawXML:
<mechatendrils cooldown="2" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/Mechatendrils" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Mechatendrils" rank="-1" rankMax="2" weaponSlotName="Mechatendrils">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<attacks mulMin="1" mulMax="3"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</mechatendrils>
Mechatendrils.name: Mechatendrils

Infernal Industry.description: Increases the energy and ore output.
Infernal Industry.flavor: A Warpsmith is an unparalleled master of technology, without the ethical or historical constraints of their erstwhile peers in the Mechanicum. If they can increase a facility’s functioning at the cost of a few hundred lives, they will.
Infernal Industry.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalIndustry" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalIndustry"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Infernal Industry.name: Infernal Industry

Webway Travel.description: Travels from one allied Webway Gate, Raider Fortress or Web Portal to another.
Webway Travel.flavor: The unique Webway sub-structure riddling Gladius Prime enables the Aeldari and Drukhari to travel rapidly between the gateways dotted across the planet—though now that they are active, wise opposing races will recognise their threat and eliminate them on first sight.
Webway Travel.rawXML:
<webwayTravel name="Drukhari/WebwayTravel">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/WebwayTravelAction">
					<effects>
						<consumedActionPoints max="0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<endTargets>
				<target>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/ShroudGate">
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Drukhari/ShroudGate"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</endTargets>
		</webwayTravel>
Webway Travel.name: Webway Travel

Combat Drugs.flavor: Though they drastically shorten the life expectancy of the user, chemical stimulants are widely used to heighten combat performance.
Combat Drugs.rawXML:
<combatDrugs consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" name="Drukhari/CombatDrugs" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/CombatDrugsUpgrade">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Drukhari/CombatDrugs" duration="10"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/Hypex">
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="10" name="MoveThroughCover"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</combatDrugs>
Combat Drugs.name: Combat Drugs

Shadowfield.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction. Goes on cooldown at the start of the next turn if damage is taken.
Shadowfield.flavor: The shadow field surrounds its wearer in a dark miasma of energy that is almost impossible to penetrate. However, should a solid blow connect the field will short out, leaving its wearer vulnerable.
Shadowfield.name: Shadowfield

Overlord.description: Increases the accuracy of this unit and adjacent Drukhari units.
Overlord.flavor: “I understand your desire, my pets. I understand you wish to increase suffering and pain, so you prolong the moment. For now, though, I require merely death. Focus on that—later, there will be more to kill.” — Gyrthineus Roche, Archon of The Last Blade
Overlord.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Drukhari/Overlord" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Drukhari/Overlord"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Overlord.name: Overlord

Ancient Evil.description: This unit and Drukhari allied units in range cause attacked units to lose morale.
Ancient Evil.flavor: So long has this Warlord lived, steeped in horror and cruelty, that he is now shrouded in a malefic aura that augments the suffering from his and his army’s attacks.
Ancient Evil.rawXML:
<ancientEvil cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Drukhari/AncientEvil" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radiusMin="1" radiusMax="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Drukhari"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="Drukhari/AncientEvil"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</ancientEvil>
Ancient Evil.name: Ancient Evil

Soul Harvest.description: Increases the damage of the target Drukhari allied unit and grants influence when this unit kills an enemy.
Soul Harvest.flavor: Few Drukhari leaders trust their underlings enough to allow them to gain power, knowing full well that the only rational use of power is to overthrow their oppressor. Despite this, occasionally a minion might be allowed off the leash, as long as its victories reflect entirely upon the Archon.
Soul Harvest.rawXML:
<soulHarvest cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Drukhari/SoulHarvest" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="Drukhari"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Drukhari/SoulHarvest"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</soulHarvest>
Soul Harvest.name: Soul Harvest

Splintered Genius.description: Grants an additional action point to this unit.
Splintered Genius.flavor: This Archon's usually calm exterior belies the truth of their debauched mind; that it is a battleground between extreme egos. Their violently sadistic side awaits only the right trigger—the fear, pain or weakness of others. Once unleashed, this Archon explodes into a killing fury, using their victims to slake their dark desires before regaining their regal composure.
Splintered Genius.rawXML:
<splinteredGenius cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Drukhari/SplinteredGenius" elite="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<actionPoints equal="0"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<actionPoints add="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</splinteredGenius>
Splintered Genius.name: Splintered Genius

Reservoir of Pain.description: Restores the hitpoints of an allied Drukhari infantry unit if this unit attacked this turn.
Reservoir of Pain.flavor: The Cronos parasite engines are an arcane blend of alchemy and science that leeches both the body and spirit of any victim. Inside its urchin-spined form, the stolen essence is magnified before being redistributed to any nearby Drukhari, refreshing and invigorating them…
Reservoir of Pain.rawXML:
<blessingsOfTheOmnissiah cooldown="1" consumedActionPoints="0" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Drukhari/ReservoirOfPain">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<attackedThisTurn/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<faction name="Drukhari"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</blessingsOfTheOmnissiah>
Reservoir of Pain.name: Reservoir of Pain

Spirit Probe.description: Grants additional feel no pain damage reduction to this unit and adjacent Drukhari infantry units at and above level 3.
Spirit Probe.flavor: A spirit probe is a conductor for agony; a device that ensures no scrap of pain or misery escapes the Cronos’ contra-empathic net. Running hot on tides of excruciation, it boosts the resilience of nearby Drukhari, allowing them to stride laughing amid volleys of fire and rains of blows that would otherwise tear them apart.
Spirit Probe.name: Spirit Probe

Twisted Animator.description: Restores the hitpoints of an adjacent Wracks unit.
Twisted Animator.flavor: This deranged creature is an artist when it comes to the reshaping of flesh. A few deft slices—and a liberal application of horrifying unguents—allow ruptured skin to flow like wax and reform anew, the subject lurching back to life.
Twisted Animator.rawXML:
<blessingsOfTheOmnissiah cooldown="1" name="Drukhari/TwistedAnimator" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<type name="Drukhari/Wrack"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</blessingsOfTheOmnissiah>
Twisted Animator.name: Twisted Animator

Master of Pain.description: Grants additional feel no pain damage reduction to this and adjacent Drukhari infantry units.
Master of Pain.flavor: Such exquisite agonies are inflicted by a Haemonculus on its followers that they barely feel their own suffering any more, as oblivious as a follower of Nurgle to the wounds inflicted on their bodies.
Master of Pain.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="Drukhari/MasterOfPain" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Drukhari/MasterOfPain"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Master of Pain.name: Master of Pain

Fleshcraft.description: Restores the hitpoints of an allied Drukhari infantry unit or monstrous creature.
Fleshcraft.flavor: Many Drukhari pass under the knives of a Haemonculus in their lives—many don’t emerge, are turned into Wracks, Grotesques or worse. But the Haemonculi are capable of healing and restoring too—they just find it tremendously dull.
Fleshcraft.rawXML:
<blessingsOfTheOmnissiah cooldown="3" name="Drukhari/Fleshcraft" rank="-1" rankMax="2" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<faction name="Drukhari"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="8" addMax="24"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</blessingsOfTheOmnissiah>
Fleshcraft.name: Fleshcraft

Crucible of Malediction.flavor: Haemonculi refer to this extraordinary weapon as ‘the kin-gift’, for it is especially dangerous to their psychically attuned craftworld cousins. Each crucible contains the essence of psykers tortured to death. When released, their spirits hurtle across the battlefield, shrieking in a cacophony that drives nearby enemies insane.
Crucible of Malediction.rawXML:
<crucibleOfMalediction cooldown="3" name="Drukhari/CrucibleOfMalediction" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<damage mulMin="0.0" mulMax="1.0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3" lineOfSight="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="CrucibleOfMalediction"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</crucibleOfMalediction>
Crucible of Malediction.name: Crucible of Malediction

Towering Arrogance.description: Decreases the morale loss of allied Drukhari units in the area.
Towering Arrogance.flavor: A Haemonculus is possessed of the knowledge that his fleshcrafting skills make him effectively immortal so has nothing but scorn for the foe, no matter how horrifying their aspect. A Haemonculus and his coven will hold their place with a derisive sneer, regardless of the odds stacked against them, anticipating the pain and death to come.
Towering Arrogance.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility elite="1" passive="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Drukhari/ToweringArrogance" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Drukhari/ToweringArrogance"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Towering Arrogance.name: Towering Arrogance

Realspace Repairs.flavor: A Drukhari trapped in realspace for any time is doomed—She Who Thirsts will slowly sip away their soul until they are a withered husk. So it pays to be able to fix up their craft to ensure a rapid return to the known perils of Commorragh.
Realspace Repairs.rawXML:
<necrodermisRepair consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="2" name="Drukhari/FieldRepairs" requiredActionPoints="0" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/FieldRepairs">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="80"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<damaged/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="12"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</necrodermisRepair>
Realspace Repairs.name: Realspace Repairs

Grisly Trophies.description: Reduces the morale loss of this unit and adjacent Drukhari units.
Grisly Trophies.flavor: Some Drukhari vehicles are adorned with the disembodied heads of slain foes and daubed with copious amounts of enemy blood. The sight of the festering remains of once proud foes instils the Drukhari with arrogant pride.
Grisly Trophies.name: Grisly Trophies

Enhanced Aethersails.flavor: Aethersails are used to capture the aetheric winds that flow out from open webway portals. Many vehicle crews are meticulous in the construction of these sails, incorporating frictionless alloys, vibro-pods and angled booms to enhance their bursts of speed.
Enhanced Aethersails.rawXML:
<supersonic consumedMovement="0" consumedActionPoints="1" cooldown="2" requiredActionPoints="1" name="Drukhari/EnhancedAethersails" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/EnhancedAethersails">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Drukhari/EnhancedAethersails"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</supersonic>
Enhanced Aethersails.name: Enhanced Aethersails

Skilled Jink.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction but reduces the accuracy. Cannot be used if the unit has attacked this turn.
Skilled Jink.flavor: Some units favour speed and agility rather than heavy armour to keep them alive on the battlefield, dodging and weaving unscathed through hails of incoming fire.
Skilled Jink.rawXML:
<jink consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" cooldown="3" name="SkilledJink">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<notAttackedThisTurn/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SkilledJink"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</jink>
Skilled Jink.name: Skilled Jink

Blood Dancer.flavor: A star of the Commorrite arenas, the Succubi excel at close quarters combat. The skills they display before the baying crowds on the blood-soaked sands of the arena floor come in equally useful on the battlefield.
Blood Dancer.rawXML:
<bloodDancer cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Drukhari/BloodDancer" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Drukhari/BloodDancer"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</bloodDancer>
Blood Dancer.name: Blood Dancer

No Escape.description: Reduces the movement of an enemy ground unit.
No Escape.flavor: Arena fighters par excellence, a Succubus is skilled at tormenting their foe, giving it the illusion of escape before reeling it in, so that all watching may savour its suffering and false hope.
No Escape.rawXML:
<noEscape cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Drukhari/NoEscape" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="Drukhari/NoEscape"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</noEscape>
No Escape.name: No Escape

Brides of Death.description: Increases the melee damage of this and adjacent Drukhari units.
Brides of Death.flavor: A succubus isn’t just impossibly perfect in appearance, combat and sadism—she also co-ordinates her Wych Cult and other Drukhari impeccably on the battlefield, a choreographer of torment.
Brides of Death.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="Drukhari/BridesOfDeath" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
