						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Drukhari/BridesOfDeath"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Brides of Death.name: Brides of Death

Whirling Death.description: Special attack that strikes all adjacent enemies.
Whirling Death.flavor: This murder-artist is constantly moving, their every acrobatic step accompanied by a lashing blade. They are at their most dangerous when the foe believes them surrounded, but this simply gives them more victims to practice their killing art upon.
Whirling Death.rawXML:
<whirlingDeath cooldown="3" elite="1" name="Drukhari/WhirlingDeath" consumedMovement="1" consumedActionPoints="1" requiredActionPoints="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
											<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="WhirlingDeath"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</whirlingDeath>
Whirling Death.name: Whirling Death

Khaine's Might.description: Increases the melee attacks of the Autarch.
Khaine's Might.flavor: An Autarch has mastery of all the Exarch shrines and has learned something from them all. Few mortal creatures can stand against the skill of an Autarch when fully unleashed.
Khaine's Might.rawXML:
<khainesMight cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Eldar/KhainesMight" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/KhainesMight"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</khainesMight>
Khaine's Might.name: Khaine's Might

Command.description: Increases the accuracy of allied Craftworld Aeldari units in the area.
Command.flavor: Autarchs walk the Path of Command, and even the Exarchs of the aspect shrines defer to them. An Autarch personally co-ordinates the fire of his army, with deft signals and comms, combining firepower and movement to lure enemies into ingenious death-traps.
Command.rawXML:
<command cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Eldar/Command" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Eldar"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/Command"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</command>
Command.name: Command

Autarch's Assault.description: Kills with the Autarch increase the damage of allied Craftworld Aeldari units in the area.
Autarch's Assault.flavor: The Autarch is the master of warfare, having lived many lives in every Aeldari aspect shrine. Every one of his skilful attacks is both an inspiration to other Aeldari and a lesson in how to conduct war most effectively.
Autarch's Assault.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Eldar/AutarchsAssault" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Eldar/AutarchsAssaultPassive"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Autarch's Assault.name: Autarch's Assault

Return of the Aeldari.description: Increases the flat amount of resources gained from outposts.
Return of the Aeldari.flavor: After the disappearance of the Old Ones, the Aeldari ruled this planet for millions of years. They understand better than anyone else how to best cultivate and access its unique resources.
Return of the Aeldari.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Eldar/ReturnOfTheAeldari" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Eldar/ReturnOfTheAeldari"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Return of the Aeldari.name: Return of the Aeldari

Khaine Awakened.description: Increases the melee attacks and melee damage, decreases the morale loss and grants immunity to fear and pinning to adjacent friendly Aeldari units.
Khaine Awakened.flavor: As the Wailing Doom cries out for blood and the Avatar rouses itself for war, so too are nearby Aeldari driven to greater deeds in his name. Fearing nothing, they throw themselves into the melee battle-crazed.
Khaine Awakened.name: Khaine Awakened

Vector Dancer.description: Increases the armour against ranged attacks.
Vector Dancer.flavor: Some aircraft are crafted with an eye towards manoeuvrability.
Vector Dancer.rawXML:
<vectorDancer consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="5" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Eldar/VectorDancer">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/VectorDancer"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</vectorDancer>
Vector Dancer.name: Vector Dancer

Mind War.description: Reduces the accuracy of target enemy unit. Deals damage based on the difference in morale between the Farseer Skyrunner and the target unit.
Mind War.flavor: The Farseer reaches out to attack the mind of an enemy in a desperate mental duel. Foes find their thoughts invaded by the crushing presence of the Farseer, his ancient and inscrutable will extinguishing their personality with horrific ease, triggering a cascade of psychosomatic trauma.
Mind War.rawXML:
<mindWar cooldown="3" name="Eldar/MindWar" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/MindWar"/>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMoraleDifference addMin="-0.5" addMax="-1.5"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</mindWar>
Mind War.name: Mind War

Doom.description: Increases the damage taken by target enemy unit.
Doom.flavor: With a simple manipulation of that which is to come, the Farseer grants a darkened fate to a chosen foe. While this shadow rests upon the enemy’s soul, death seeks them out above all others, each blow or shot that comes their way rendered inescapably lethal.
Doom.rawXML:
<doom cooldown="3" name="Eldar/Doom" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Eldar/Doom"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/Doom"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</doom>
Doom.name: Doom

Will of Asuryan.description: Restores the morale of allied units in the area.
Will of Asuryan.flavor: The leader of the Aeldari Gods, Asuryan provided guidance to the growing Aeldari race before his consumption by Slaanesh. The Farseers of Gladius can draw upon his might to bolster their forces, inspiring them to fight on.
Will of Asuryan.rawXML:
<willOfAsuryan cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Eldar/WillOfAsuryan" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="2" addMax="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</willOfAsuryan>
Will of Asuryan.name: Will of Asuryan

Linked Fire.description: Increases the damage and armor penetration of target allied Fire Prism’s Prism Cannon.
Linked Fire.flavor: The unusual design of a Fire Prism’s Prism Cannon crystal is designed to allow it to further concentrate its already-intense beam by feeding it into another Fire Prism, focusing both machine’s firepower into a single shot.
Linked Fire.rawXML:
<linkedFire cooldown="1" name="Eldar/LinkedFire">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1" rangeMin="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<type name="Eldar/FirePrism"/>
							<noTrait name="Eldar/LinkedFire"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/LinkedFire"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</linkedFire>
Linked Fire.name: Linked Fire

Crystal Targeting Matrix.flavor: Utilising advanced scanner technologies, this targeting matrix allows pinpoint fire even when on the move.
Crystal Targeting Matrix.rawXML:
<crystalTargetingMatrix consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="5" name="Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrix" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrix">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrix"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</crystalTargetingMatrix>
Crystal Targeting Matrix.name: Crystal Targeting Matrix

Vectored Engines.description: Increases the armour against ranged attacks.
Vectored Engines.flavor: Vectored engines allow the pilot of an Aeldari vehicle to rapidly alter its facing, placing deadly weapons, or stronger armour, to the fore. Often, this can mean the difference between sustaining critical damage and taking an indirect blow that can soon be shrugged off.
Vectored Engines.rawXML:
<vectoredEngines consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="5" name="Eldar/VectoredEngines" requiredActionPoints="0" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/VectoredEngines">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/VectoredEngines"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</vectoredEngines>
Vectored Engines.name: Vectored Engines

Shrouding.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of this unit and adjacent allied units.
Shrouding.flavor: The psyker uses his mastery of the Warp to fog the minds of his enemies, clouding their sight and instincts so that he appears as nothing more than an indistinct shadow.
Shrouding.rawXML:
<shrouding consumedActionPoints="1" cooldown="3" requiredActionPoints="1" name="Shrouding">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Shrouded"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</shrouding>
Shrouding.name: Shrouding

Dominate.description: Prevents target enemy infantry or monstrous creature from acting.
Dominate.flavor: The psyker reaches into his foe’s mind, trammelling his soul and crushing his will to fight on.
Dominate.rawXML:
<dominate consumedActionPoints="1" cooldown="1" name="Dominate" requiredActionPoints="1" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/Dominate">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Stunned"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Stunned"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</dominate>
Dominate.name: Dominate

War Shout.description: Reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units.
War Shout.flavor: In Aeldari mythology, banshees foreshadow the death of warriors with their howl. The Howling Banshee aspect warriors wear a specialised mask that amplifies and weaponises their thoughts into psychic screams. Whilst their foes are stunned, the Banshees close, power swords at the ready…
War Shout.rawXML:
<warShout consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" name="Eldar/WarShout" requiredActionPoints="0" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/WarShout">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale add="-3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</warShout>
War Shout.name: War Shout

Spirit Mark.description: Increases the accuracy of allied Wraithblades and Wraithknights.
Spirit Mark.flavor: The Avatar’s presence invigorates the dead distinctly from the living. Whilst the latter are filled with Khaine’s incandescent rage, those machines manned by spirit crystals instead find their awareness raised from their usual somnambulance, enabling them to better focus on their targets.
Spirit Mark.name: Spirit Mark

Renewer / Destructor.description: Restores the hitpoints of target allied unit or damages target enemy unit.
Renewer / Destructor.flavor: Caging a portion of his psychic might, the Spiritseer sends waves of energy forth to destroy his enemies in a burst of azure flame--or, if the need arises, heal the wounds of his allies.
Renewer / Destructor.rawXML:
<destructorRenewer cooldown="2" name="Eldar/DestructorRenewer" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<damage mulMin="0.0" mulMax="1.0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit/>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="4" addMax="12"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="Destructor"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</destructorRenewer>
Renewer / Destructor.name: Renewer / Destructor

Protect / Jinx.description: Increases the armour of target allied unit or decreases the armour of target enemy unit.
Protect / Jinx.flavor: Chained by runes of power, fate itself is bound to the Spiritseer’s will.
Protect / Jinx.rawXML:
<protectJinx cooldown="2" name="Eldar/ProtectJinx" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit/>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/Protect"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/Jinx"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</protectJinx>
Protect / Jinx.name: Protect / Jinx

Embolden / Horrify.description: Restores the morale of target allied unit or decreases the morale of target enemy unit.
Embolden / Horrify.flavor: The Spiritseer calls down the splendour of battle, instilling his allies with valour or sapping courage from his foes.
Embolden / Horrify.rawXML:
<emboldenHorrify cooldown="2" name="Eldar/EmboldenHorrify" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit/>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="3" addMax="9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="-3" addMax="-9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</emboldenHorrify>
Embolden / Horrify.name: Embolden / Horrify

Hallucination.description: Decreases the attacks of target enemy unit.
Hallucination.flavor: Paranoia, confusion and panic are heightened to a debilitating degree as the telepath alters his foes’ perceptions.
Hallucination.rawXML:
<hallucination cooldown="3" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Hallucination" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Hallucination"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Hallucination"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</hallucination>
Hallucination.name: Hallucination

Gate of Infinity.flavor: The psyker punches a corridor through the roiling Immaterium, allowing him to cross great distances in the blink of an eye.
Gate of Infinity.name: Gate of Infinity

Hammerhand.flavor: Focussing the raging power of his mind, the psyker augments the strength of his comrades to the point where they can crush flesh and bone with a single blow.
Hammerhand.rawXML:
<hammerhand consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Hammerhand" psychicPower="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Hammerhand"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</hammerhand>
Hammerhand.name: Hammerhand

Necrodermis Repair.flavor: If a Necron is only mildly damaged, their living metal body can somewhat heal itself, flowing reserve metals to cover flaws and failings.
Necrodermis Repair.rawXML:
<necrodermisRepair consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="Necrons/NecrodermisRepair" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="60"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/NecrodermisRepair3">
					<effects>
						<cooldown max="0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<damaged/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/NecrodermisRepair2">
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="2"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</necrodermisRepair>
Necrodermis Repair.name: Necrodermis Repair

Quantum Shielding.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction. Goes on cooldown at the start of the next turn if damage is taken.
Quantum Shielding.flavor: Necron quantum shielding is a marvel of science, existing only at the precise moment of deflection—at all other times there is no indication of its presence. They are, however, temperamental devices, prone to malfunction if overloaded.
Quantum Shielding.name: Quantum Shielding

Found City (Necrons).description:
Consumes the unit to found a new city.

Necron cities can only be found on top of Necron Tombs and if there are no other cities within a 4 tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by 6.
Found City (Necrons).rawXML:
<foundCity name="FoundCityNecrons" icon="Actions/FoundCity">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<energyCost base="40"/>
						<influenceCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>	
			<beginTargets>
				<target>
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<feature name="NecronTomb"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</foundCity>
Found City (Necrons).name: Found City (Necrons)

Scarab Hive.flavor: Canoptek Scarabs sweep across the battlefield in vast, undulating swarms that devour all in their path. Mindless feeding machines, the Scarabs are constructs designed to break down matter into raw energy that can then be woven into fresh forms. Within the confines of a tomb this process is one of clearing and manufacture, but on the battlefield it is a powerful force of destruction.
Scarab Hive.rawXML:
<scarabHive cooldown="5" icon="Units/Necrons/CanoptekScarab" name="Necrons/ScarabHive" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/ScarabHive">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<energyCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Necrons/CanoptekScarab" consumedAction="0" consumedMovement="0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</scarabHive>
Scarab Hive.name: Scarab Hive

Fabricator Claw Array.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.
Fabricator Claw Array.flavor: This clicking, whirring proliferation of energy tools is primarily intended for maintenance and repair.
Fabricator Claw Array.rawXML:
<fabricatorClawArray cooldown="1" name="Necrons/FabricatorClawArray">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</fabricatorClawArray>
Fabricator Claw Array.name: Fabricator Claw Array

Gloom Prism.description: Increases the witchfire damage reduction of the Canoptek Spyder and adjacent allied units.
Gloom Prism.flavor: The gloom prism's energy field creates a zone shrouded from Warp-spawned powers.
Gloom Prism.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Necrons/GloomPrism" passive="1" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/GloomPrism">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Necrons/GloomPrism"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Gloom Prism.name: Gloom Prism

Dimensional Corridor.description: Teleports to a tile adjacent to a city or Monolith.
Dimensional Corridor.flavor:
“And first to walk the starlight bridge, from incorporeal to corporeal, was Artemorra, to whom the Necrontyr gave the name 'Messenger', later changed to 'Deceiver'—with good reason.”
  — Fragmentary inscription on a Jokaerian Defence Orb
Dimensional Corridor.rawXML:
<dimensionalCorridor cooldown="3" name="Necrons/DimensionalCorridor" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/DimensionalCorridor">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="30"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/DimensionalCorridor2">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.33"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/DimensionalCorridor3">
					<effects>
						<consumedActionPoints max="0"/>
						<consumedMovement max="0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</dimensionalCorridor>
Dimensional Corridor.name: Dimensional Corridor

Resurrection Orb.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied unit.
Resurrection Orb.flavor: This glowing sphere focuses energy into the regeneration circuits of nearby Necrons, enhancing their ability to self-repair.
Resurrection Orb.rawXML:
<resurrectionOrb cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.15" name="Necrons/ResurrectionOrb" rank="-1" rankMax="2"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="6" addMax="18"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</resurrectionOrb>
Resurrection Orb.name: Resurrection Orb

Chronometron.description: Increases damage reduction of the target allied unit.
Chronometron.flavor: These eye-shaped devices project a bubble of energy that can alter the flow of time itself, slowing incoming projectiles such that those nearby can simply move out of their path.
Chronometron.rawXML:
<chronometron cooldown="1" levelUpPriority="0.1" name="Necrons/Chronometron" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Necrons/Chronometron"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</chronometron>
Chronometron.name: Chronometron

Mindshackle Scarabs.description: Reduces the morale of the target enemy unit.
Mindshackle Scarabs.flavor: At the bearer's command, tiny mindshackle scarabs burrow into their target's brain, bypassing cerebral functions and robbing the unfortunate victim of their wits.
Mindshackle Scarabs.rawXML:
<mindshackleScarabs cooldown="1" name="Necrons/MindshackleScarabs" rank="-1" rankMax="2"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="AndTheyShallKnowNoFear"/>
							<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
							<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="-4" addMax="-12"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</mindshackleScarabs>
Mindshackle Scarabs.name: Mindshackle Scarabs

Solar Pulse.description: Reduces the accuracy of enemy infantry and monstrous creature units in the area.
Solar Pulse.flavor: The Solar Staff burns with the light of truth and honour, and when its powers are unleashed they are a bane to all shadows. Set loose, the staff's energies blaze outward in a mighty flare, as though a new sun was born. The darkness is driven back by this false dawn, and the foe reels as their eyes are blinded and their deceptions are laid bare.
Solar Pulse.rawXML:
<solarPulse cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Necrons/SolarPulse" rank="-1" rankMax="0"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Blind"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</solarPulse>
Solar Pulse.name: Solar Pulse

Hunters from Hyperspace.description: Teleports to target explored tile and increases damage.
Hunters from Hyperspace.flavor: These deadly marksmen seldom take position with the rest of the army. Instead, they slip sideways out of reality and monitor the conflict from a hyperspace oubliette – a pocket dimension riding the gap between the then and now. The Deathmarks track enemy communication channels, teleport beams and orbital descents in order to select suitably high-profile prey. This done, they exit their oubliette to tag their quarry with the hunter’s mark from which they take their name – an eerie green energy halo that plays about the target’s head in five dimensions.
Hunters from Hyperspace.rawXML:
<huntersFromHyperspace cooldown="10" consumedActionPoints="0" name="Necrons/HuntersFromHyperspace" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<endTargets>
				<target>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Necrons/HuntersFromHyperspace"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</endTargets>
		</huntersFromHyperspace>
Hunters from Hyperspace.name: Hunters from Hyperspace

Jet Charge.description: Increases damage reduction and flies across obstacles to the target tile.
Jet Charge.flavor: In its limitless rage, a headstrong Necron Destroyer Lord can overcharge its grav-platform to move short distances extremely quickly, albeit at a further cost to its reason.
Jet Charge.rawXML:
<jetCharge cooldown="3" name="Necrons/JetCharge" rank="-1" rankMax="2"> 
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<movement add="1"/>
						<movementMax add="1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Necrons/JetCharge"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/HammerOfWrath">
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="HammerOfWrath"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</jetCharge>
Jet Charge.name: Jet Charge

Bloody Crusade.flavor: In its desire to rid the universe of organic life, a Destroyer Lord can descend into a savage insanity, raining blow after blow on its opponents, far beyond safe protocols.
Bloody Crusade.rawXML:
<bloodyCrusade name="Necrons/BloodyCrusade" levelUpPriority="0.1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Necrons/BloodyCrusade"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</bloodyCrusade>
Bloody Crusade.name: Bloody Crusade

Destruction Protocols.description: Increases the damage taken for adjacent enemy units.
Destruction Protocols.flavor: When a Necron Lord falls to the Destroyer curse, they abandon the caution and of their Defensive Protocols, reconfiguring their engrammic pathways to augment the aggression of their peers, not their defensive capabilities.
Destruction Protocols.rawXML:
<destructionProtocols name="Necrons/DestructionProtocols" levelUpPriority="0.1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Necrons/DestructionProtocols"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</destructionProtocols>
Destruction Protocols.name: Destruction Protocols

Reaper.description: Increases the armour and accuracy. Jet Charge recharges when the Destroyer Lord gains experience from combat.
Reaper.flavor: Where the Flayers suffer the deathcurse of Llandu'gor, the Destroyers' madness derives from the universal fate of all Necrons—the loss of their souls when they took on living metal bodies. In the Destroyers, this drives them to refine themselves more and more, to become closer to perfect weapons—curiously, thus, closer to Aza'gorod, the Nightbringer, the doom of all life.
Reaper.rawXML:
<reaper cooldown="10" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Necrons/Reaper" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Necrons/Reaper"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</reaper>
Reaper.name: Reaper

Phase Shift Generator.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction of the Gauss Pylon and adjacent allied Necron units.
Phase Shift Generator.flavor: When a Gauss Pylon is raised from the ground, it creates a temporal bubble altering the local flow of space time. Nearby Necrons can take advantage of this, shifting out of phase with reality to avoid destruction.
Phase Shift Generator.name: Phase Shift Generator

Repair Barge.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied Necron infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Repair Barge.flavor: Stately they might be, but these sinister vehicles are as great a threat as the better-known Monolith. Their role is to support the Necron army, gliding across the battlefield and disgorging minute repair scarabs to return even the most devastated Necron warriors to battle readiness, before transporting them back to the fray.
Repair Barge.rawXML:
<blessingsOfTheOmnissiah cooldown="1" name="Necrons/RepairBarge">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<faction name="Necrons"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>

Construct Gauss Pylon.description: Powerful defence turret that shields allied Necron units.
Construct Gauss Pylon.flavor: The mysterious Necron defence turrets, designated as 'Pylons' by those who originally encountered them, were first recorded on the uncharted world of WDY-272. Rising suddenly from the desert sands, the Gauss Pylons opened fire without warning and with devastating effect, tanks and armoured carriers burning as the crescent-shaped weapons tore through the unsuspecting Imperial Guard column whilst resisting all return fire.
Construct Gauss Pylon.rawXML:
<constructGaussPylon icon="Units/Necrons/GaussPylon" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/GaussPylon" cooldown="5">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="240"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Resource"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Necrons/GaussPylon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</constructGaussPylon>
Construct Gauss Pylon.name: Construct Gauss Pylon

Void Strike.description: Performs a Voidblade attack with increased attacks.
Void Strike.flavor:
“The best weapon is the one that you never have to use.”
  — Kanaa the Tranquil, Necron Cryptek, creator of the Void Strike
Void Strike.rawXML:
<voidStrike cooldown="3" name="Necrons/VoidStrike" rank="-1" rankMax="2" weaponSlotName="Voidblade">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<attacks addMin="6" addMax="12"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</voidStrike>
Void Strike.name: Void Strike

Defensive Protocols.description: Increases the armour of the Lord and allied Necron units in range.
Defensive Protocols.flavor: A Necron’s Lords higher functions aren’t devoted to containing a more-charming personality or a fiercer intelligence—they also contain control protocols that enable them to coordinate nearby Necron troops more minutely, heavily increasing their chances of survival.
Defensive Protocols.rawXML:
<defensiveProtocols cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.15" name="Necrons/DefensiveProtocols" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radiusMin="1" radiusMax="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Necrons"/>
											
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Necrons/DefensiveProtocols"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</defensiveProtocols>
Defensive Protocols.name: Defensive Protocols

Dynasty.description: Increases the population limit of cities.
Dynasty.flavor: It’s a truism that the greatest leaders attract the largest numbers of followers—or in the case of the Necrons, the greatest leaders have wider security permissions over their Canoptek maintenance units, enabling a higher population density in a given location.

<dynasty name="Necrons/Dynasty" levelUpPriority="0.1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">

					</areas>
				</selfTarget>

		</dynasty>
Dynasty.name: Dynasty

Royal Guard.flavor:
“I have watched the galaxy for sixty million years. I have raised civilisations to our ways and seen them thrive, fade and pass into myth. And I still believe that to exist without honour, without laws—well, it is better not to exist at all.”
  — Eystan, Triarch Praetorian

<royalGuard cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Necrons/RoyalGuard" rank="-1" rankMax="0"> 
			<beginTargets>

The Bound Coalescent.description: Merges with an Obelisk to create a Tesseract Vault.
The Bound Coalescent.flavor: The C'tan were immeasurably-powerful and wholly evil; these shards, fragmented by the Necrons' desperate conspiracy, are all that remains of them. In desperate times, two shards might be allowed to re-coalesce, to form a greater weapon—but the Necrons never forget the insane power of the originals.
The Bound Coalescent.rawXML:
<theBoundCoalescent name="Necrons/TheBoundCoalescent" icon="Units/Necrons/TesseractVault" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/TheBoundCoalescent">

					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<type name="Necrons/Obelisk"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">

									<effects>

									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>

									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>

					<areas>

									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</endTargets>
		</theBoundCoalescent>

Grabbin' Klaw.flavor: In their pursuit of ever-larger Power Klaws, Ork Meks occasionally make ones that are simply too large for even the most over-sized Boss or Deff Dread. These are mounted on vehicles, where they are used to immobilise enemy vehicles or perform outrageous handbrake turns.
Grabbin' Klaw.rawXML:

			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>

							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
							<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
							<noTrait name="Skimmer"/>

					<areas>

							</modifiers>

				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</grabbinKlaw>
Grabbin' Klaw.name: Grabbin' Klaw

Kustom Force Field.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of this unit and adjacent allied units.
Kustom Force Field.flavor: These bizarre devices are powered by crackling energy-coils and project invisible bubbles of energy that shield nearby Orks from incoming fire.
Kustom Force Field.name: Kustom Force Field

'Ere We Go!.flavor: Ever eager to get stuck into the fray, Orks will barrel across the battlefield as quick as they can when the foe is in their sights.

								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</ereWeGo>
'Ere We Go!.name: 'Ere We Go!

Mek's Tools.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.
Mek's Tools.flavor:
“Yer arm? I don't care about yer arm! Me trukk's zogging ruined! Did no wun tell you to stay away from Laskannons? 'Ere, Grot. Pass me the wotsit, the thingummy, and the whacker. And the red paint, o' course. She'll be all shiny-new in no time.”
  — Skinwab, Evil Sunz Mek
Mek's Tools.rawXML:
<meksTools cooldown="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>

					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</meksTools>
Mek's Tools.name: Mek's Tools

Cybork Implants.flavor:
“Exhibit 40: Ork skin sample. This was from a senior individual in the Orkoid hierarchy, as can be seen from the increased thickness of bone, muscle and ablative skin, and the reduction in nerve structures. The laser grid is there to prevent it attempting to regrow the entire Ork.“
  — Lecture transcripts, Grigomen “Orklover” Delr, Rogue Trader and amateur Xenologist

Experimental Procedure.flavor:
“Exhibit 12: Ork biomechanical modification. 'Cyborks' are modified with equipment like this by the species' innate specialists, the 'Oddboyz', to repair major injuries and/or augment their capabilities. This one resembles an Imperial power weapon, save for the large claws and maker's mark which reads 'Grillmek woz 'ere!'“

  — Da Rok, Ork Nob
Bust Heads.rawXML:
<bustHeads cooldown="5" name="Orks/BustHeads" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="2">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Orks/BustHeads"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</bustHeads>
Bust Heads.name: Bust Heads

Prophet of the Waaagh!.description: Increase the influence gain when dealing damage for units with Might Makes Right in the region.
Prophet of the Waaagh!.flavor:
“I'm da hand of Gork and Mork, dey sent me to rouse up da boyz to crush and kill 'cos da boyz forgot what dere 'ere for… I'm da profit of da Waaagh an' whole worlds burn in my boot prints. I'm Warlord Ghazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka an' I speak wiv da word of da gods.”
  — Ghazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka, Ork Warlord
modifiers: - +50% Influence Per Combat From Upkeep Factor
Prophet of the Waaagh!.rawXML:
<prophetOfTheWaaagh cooldown="10" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Orks/ProphetOfTheWaaagh" rank="-1" rankMax="0" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<trait name="Orks/MightMakesRight"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="5" name="Orks/ProphetOfTheWaaagh"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</prophetOfTheWaaagh>
Prophet of the Waaagh!.name: Prophet of the Waaagh!

Warpath.description: Increases the number of melee attacks of the Weirdboy and adjacent Mob Rule allied units.
Warpath.flavor: The Weirdboy disperses the Waaagh! energy coursing through his frame into the Ork warriors around him, stirring their already bellicose, warlike nature to roaring fever pitch.
Warpath.rawXML:
<warpath cooldown="2" levelUpPriority="0.3" name="Orks/Warpath" rank="-1" rankMax="2"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<trait name="MobRule"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Orks/Warpath"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</warpath>
Warpath.name: Warpath

Channel Mental Emissions.description: Increases the research output of the clan.
Channel Mental Emissions.flavor:
“The Orks are the pinnacle of creation. For them, the great struggle is won. They have evolved a society which knows no stress or angst. Who are we to judge them? We Aeldari who have failed, or the Humans, on the road to ruin in their turn? And why? Because we sought answers to questions that an Ork wouldn't even bother to ask! We see a culture that is strong and despise it as crude.”
  — Uthan the Perverse, Aeldari Philosopher
Channel Mental Emissions.rawXML:
<channelMentalEmissions name="Orks/ChannelMentalEmissions" levelUpPriority="0.2" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Orks/ChannelMentalEmissions"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</channelMentalEmissions>
Channel Mental Emissions.name: Channel Mental Emissions

Da Jump.description: Teleports the Weirdboy and adjacent allied units to the target tile and adjacent tiles.
Da Jump.flavor: The Weirdboy closes his eyes tight and, in a storm of flashing green light, teleports himself to another part of the battlefield—along with any confused Boyz who happened to be standing too close to him at the time.
Da Jump.rawXML:
<daJump cooldownMin="5" cooldownMax="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="0" name="Orks/DaJump" radius="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			</daJump>
Da Jump.name: Da Jump

Light of the Emperor.description:
Increases the accuracy.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Light of the Emperor.flavor: Sisters of the Adepta Sororitas are filled with the knowledge that the only thing they need fear is failing the Emperor of Mankind. Armed with such faith, they are driven to unprecedented feats of prowess.
Light of the Emperor.rawXML:
<lightOfTheEmperor consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/LightOfTheEmperor" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/LightOfTheEmperor"/>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedActOfFaith"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</lightOfTheEmperor>
Light of the Emperor.name: Light of the Emperor

The Passion.description:
Increases the melee accuracy of the Canoness and adjacent allied units.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
The Passion.flavor: A Canoness leads her Sisters through the chaos of melee, striking at their foes with a speed and hatred born of holy fervour.
The Passion.rawXML:
<thePassion consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/ThePassion" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<conditions>
				<unit>

				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/ThePassion"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>

The Passion.name: The Passion

Lead The Righteous.description: Increases the accuracy of this unit and nearby allied Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Lead The Righteous.flavor:
“A Canoness is no skulking commissar, to hide behind her sisters’ skirts and send them to her deaths. My role is to lead from the front, to inspire love and faith by my example. For we are the righteous of the Emperor and we will not fail in our aim.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute
Lead The Righteous.rawXML:
<leadTheRighteous cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/LeadTheRighteous" requiredActionPoints="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="2">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
											<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/LeadTheRighteous"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</leadTheRighteous>
Lead The Righteous.name: Lead The Righteous

Death Before Disgrace.description: Restores the morale of the target allied unit.
Death Before Disgrace.flavor:
“What is death, to us? We are not fodder for laughing gods. We are not enshrined in stones, like the foul Aeldari. For us death is an end to service, a reward only given if we do not seek it. So act as if each moment is your last, but strive against that day with all your heart.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute
Death Before Disgrace.rawXML:
<deathBeforeDisgrace cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/DeathBeforeDisgrace" requiredActionPoints="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="3" addMax="9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</deathBeforeDisgrace>
Death Before Disgrace.name: Death Before Disgrace

Divine Deliverance.description: This unit and adjacent allied Adepta Sororitas units cause attacked units to lose morale.
Divine Deliverance.flavor: Enemy warlords tremble before the divine majesty of one blessed by the Emperor, and their minions quake before the booming onslaught of such a warrior’s companions.
Divine Deliverance.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/DivineDeliverance" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>

								<modifier>

								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Divine Deliverance.name: Divine Deliverance

Righteous Judgement.description: Ignores ranged damage reduction and increases damage taken by the target enemy unit.
Righteous Judgement.flavor: None can escape the Emperor’s judgement, and wherever the foe attempts to seek shelter the shots of the Adepta Sororitas miraculously seek them out.
Righteous Judgement.rawXML:
<righteousJudgement cooldown="3" elite="1" name="SistersOfBattle/RighteousJudgement" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/RighteousJudgement"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</righteousJudgement>
Righteous Judgement.name: Righteous Judgement

Laud Hailer.description: Adjacent Adepta Sororitas units can perform Acts of Faith even if they are shaken.
Laud Hailer.flavor: Proclaiming the power of the Emperor in heavenly tones, a Laud Hailer bolsters the spirits of the faithful.

<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer" requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer">

				<selfTarget>

						<area affects="Tile" excludeRadius="0" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>

									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Laud Hailer.name: Laud Hailer

Bodyguard.description: Grants additional protection to adjacent allied heroes.
Bodyguard.flavor: Celestians are those Sisters most filled with martial spirit, proving themselves in the most intense melees. They frequently serve as bodyguards and champions of Canonesses, willingly sacrificing themselves to protect their charge.
Bodyguard.name: Bodyguard

Keepers of the Faith.description:
Prevents overwatch but increases the damage reduction if this unit has actions remaining.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Keepers of the Faith.flavor:
“Reason says, fire when you see the enemy. Reason says, use cover when the enemy fires at you. Reason says, die when you are shot. Reason does not understand our faith and how we keep it.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Keepers of the Faith.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility disableable="1" passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaith">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<actionPoints greater="0"/>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaith"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Keepers of the Faith.name: Keepers of the Faith

Flank Speed.description: Increases the movement, but prevents the use of ranged weapons.
Flank Speed.flavor:
“One should not question the nobility of Questor Imperialis. But for faith, none can match the Knight-Lancer, which goes into battle armed only with a spear and its own prodigious speed, praying that it makes it to the enemy lines. It is a fine match for our forces.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Flank Speed.rawXML:
<flankSpeed consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeed" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<notAttackedThisTurn/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeed"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</flankSpeed>
Flank Speed.name: Flank Speed

Endless Crusade.description:
Gains Fleet and Move Through Cover.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Endless Crusade.flavor: Limbs do not tire when the spirit of the Emperor moves them, but find fresh strength in the righteous work to come.

						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>

				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>

			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>

									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Fleet"/>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="MoveThroughCover"/>

								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</endlessCrusade>
Endless Crusade.name: Endless Crusade

Verse of Holy Piety.description: Reduces the cooldown of Acts of Faith on the target unit.
Verse of Holy Piety.flavor: Pray is stronger than any sword. As the sanctified words of the Order’s holy tenets are roared across the battlefield, the devout are infused with the Emperor’s blessings.
Verse of Holy Piety.rawXML:
<verseOfHolyPiety cooldown="1" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/VerseOfHolyPiety" requiredActionPoints="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">

					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/EndlessCrusade"/>

					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="UnitAction">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit match="Any">
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/EndlessCrusade"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/ThePassion"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguish"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/LightOfTheEmperor"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/DivineGuidance"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<cooldown addMin="-3" addMax="-9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</verseOfHolyPiety>
Verse of Holy Piety.name: Verse of Holy Piety

Catechism of Repugnance.description: Increases the ranged accuracy and ranged armor penetration of the target Adepta Sororitas allied unit.
Catechism of Repugnance.flavor: With the holy bolter we shall cleanse the mutant, the alien and the heretic. With the Emperor’s gift do we deliver our hatred of the defiler.
Catechism of Repugnance.rawXML:
<catechismOfRepugnance cooldown="1" consumedActionPoints="1" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/CatechismOfRepugnance" requiredActionPoints="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/CatechismOfRepugnance"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</catechismOfRepugnance>
Catechism of Repugnance.name: Catechism of Repugnance

Stirring Rhetoric.description: This unit and nearby allied units that used an Act of Faith gain additional armor.
Stirring Rhetoric.flavor:
“There is no light but the light of the Emperor! There is no faith but faith in the Emperor! There is no truth but the truth of the Emperor!”
  — First Exclamation of the Dialogus Order of the Resounding Vow
Stirring Rhetoric.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/StirringRhetoric" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="2">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/StirringRhetoric"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Stirring Rhetoric.name: Stirring Rhetoric

War Hymn.description: Increases the melee attacks of the target Adepta Sororitas non-super-heavy allied unit.
War Hymn.flavor: Suffer not the enemies of Mankind to live. Smite them down with all your strength and fury.
War Hymn.rawXML:
<warHymn cooldown="3" elite="1" name="SistersOfBattle/WarHymn" consumedMovement="0" consumedActionPoints="1" requiredActionPoints="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
							<noTrait name="SuperHeavy"/>
						</unit>
						<weapon>
							<trait name="Melee"/>
						</weapon>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="SistersOfBattle/WarHymn"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</warHymn>
War Hymn.name: War Hymn

Divine Guidance.description:
Increases the damage and armour penetration.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Divine Guidance.flavor: As the combatants of the sorority recite rites of destruction, their aim faithfully falls where it will cause the most harm – every shot and every strike becoming a mortal blow that condemns another heretic to oblivion.
Divine Guidance.rawXML:
<divineGuidance consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/DivineGuidance" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Rending"/>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedActOfFaith"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</divineGuidance>
Divine Guidance.name: Divine Guidance

Sacred Healing.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied infantry unit.
Sacred Healing.flavor: Implements of both torture and salvation, the chirurgeon’s tools can restore the fallen so that they might fight once more.
Sacred Healing.rawXML:
<sacredHealing cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/SacredHealing">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</sacredHealing>
Sacred Healing.name: Sacred Healing

Medicus Ministorum.description: Grants feel no pain damage reduction to adjacent allied infantry units.
Medicus Ministorum.flavor: A Medicus Ministorum is a medical field kit used by members of the Adeptus Ministorum and by the Hospitallers of the Adepta Sororitas. Contained within a rare scentwood box are a collection of relics which are used to cure all manner of injuries and ailments.
Medicus Ministorum.name: Medicus Ministorum

Tale of the Warrior.description: Increases the melee damage of adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Warrior.flavor: When the Imagifiers chant their tales of ancient battles of Istvaan V, of Sanguinius at the Eternity Gate, of Horus’ downfall, the Battle Sisters become suffused with the martial spirit of their forebears, every blow landing like the Emperor’s fist.
Tale of the Warrior.rawXML:
<taleOfTheWarrior consumedActionPoints="1" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheWarrior" requiredActionPoints="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
											<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheWarrior"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</taleOfTheWarrior>
Tale of the Warrior.name: Tale of the Warrior

Tale of the Stoic.description: Increases the damage reduction of this unit and adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Stoic.flavor: Hearing the stories of the Emperor’s eternal suffering and silent resilience, each Sister is filled with His courage. Their will-to-fight in His name is indefatigable and they push through injuries so grievous that an average man would be long-dead from shock. Yet they are neither average nor men.
Tale of the Stoic.rawXML:
<taleOfTheStoic consumedActionPoints="1" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheStoic" requiredActionPoints="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
											<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheStoic"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</taleOfTheStoic>
Tale of the Stoic.name: Tale of the Stoic

Tale of the Faithful.description: Increases the movement of this unit and adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Faithful.flavor: From a young age, the initiates of the Adepta Sororitas exercise and pray backed by the sonorous songs of the Imagifiers, inspired to superhuman feats by the testaments of their long-dead sisters. Even cynical veterans, hearing the song in their dotage, are inspired to transcend their body’s limitations, moving with impossible swiftness and blessed grace.
Tale of the Faithful.rawXML:
<taleOfTheFaithful consumedActionPoints="1" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheFaithful" requiredActionPoints="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
											<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheFaithful"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</taleOfTheFaithful>
Tale of the Faithful.name: Tale of the Faithful

Agile.description: Increases the movement, but decreases the attacks.
Agile.flavor: Size doesn’t preclude speed. Look at the incredible manoeuvrability of the Imperium’s Lightning Fighter. Or take the Tyranid’s Hierodule. Instead of lumbering forward like a lumpen Ogryn, their focus and grace is closer to that of a Harlequin. A hungry Harlequin the size of a house, admittedly, with acid drool and scytheblade arms the length of a Land Raider, that is. But elegant all the same.
Agile.rawXML:
<agile name="Agile" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" requiredActionPoints="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Agile"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</agile>
Agile.name: Agile

Miraculous Intervention.description:
After dying, Saint Celestine immediately comes back to life.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Miraculous Intervention.flavor: Not even death can stop the Emperor’s chosen servants, and through his benevolence they rise again to serve the Master of Mankind’s will.
Miraculous Intervention.rawXML:
<miraculousIntervention beginOnDisappear="1" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention" passive="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<destroyed/>
											<noTrait name="Broken"/>
										</unit>
										<unit match="Any">
											<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
											<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="1.0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</miraculousIntervention>
Miraculous Intervention.name: Miraculous Intervention

Beacon of Faith.description: Restore the morale of this unit and nearby allied units.
Beacon of Faith.flavor:
“The Khornate warriors threatened to overwhelm us, we were cut and rent and thrown aside… even the Canoness fell… and then She intervened. As She descended, a shining beacon, our wounds closed, our spirits rallied and we drove back the heretics with newfound devotion…”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Beacon of Faith.rawXML:
<beaconOfFaith cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/BeaconOfFaith" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="2">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="2" addMax="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</beaconOfFaith>
Beacon of Faith.name: Beacon of Faith

Healing Tears.description: Restores a portion of Saint Celestine's hitpoints.
Healing Tears.flavor:
“And, lo, the tears were human, tears for her lost sisters, tears for the endless war—but they were transfigured in their descent and where they struck, they blessed. And the Saint herself roused herself up with righteous fury…”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Healing Tears.rawXML:
<healingTears cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/HealingTears" requiredActionPoints="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax addMin="0.1" addMax="0.3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</healingTears>
Healing Tears.name: Healing Tears

Saintly Blessings.description: Grants additional damage reduction to this unit and adjacent allied units.
Saintly Blessings.flavor: In the presence of an ordained Living Saint, even the most impious of the Emperor’s servants cannot help but be swept up by the tide of religious fervour.
Saintly Blessings.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/SaintlyBlessings" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/SaintlyBlessings"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Saintly Blessings.name: Saintly Blessings

The Emperor's Vengeance.description: Calls down a divine ray to bombard enemy positions.
The Emperor's Vengeance.flavor:
“This was not in the doctrines, nor the ephemera, nor even the apocrypha. This planet had drained the Saint, it is true. But at moments of great wrath, her true power broke through, all at once, and devastated those who dared to stand against her.”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
The Emperor's Vengeance.rawXML:
<theEmperorsVengeance cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" name="SistersOfBattle/TheEmperorsVengeance">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="TheEmperorsVengeance"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</theEmperorsVengeance>
The Emperor's Vengeance.name: The Emperor's Vengeance

Solace in Anguish.description:
Increases the damage reduction.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Solace in Anguish.flavor:
“I had seen a Preacher impaled on a steeple. The remains of a missionary found by genestealer cultists. We felt the loss so strongly—but our anguish did not weaken us, but spurred us on…”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Solace in Anguish.rawXML:
<solaceInAnguish consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguish" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguish"/>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedActOfFaith"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</solaceInAnguish>
Solace in Anguish.name: Solace in Anguish

Narthecium.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Narthecium.flavor: The narthecium is used by Space Marine Apothecaries to dispense medical aid, including complex battlefield surgery, to the wounded. The wrist-mounted device also houses a reductor—the mechanism with which the gene-seed of the fallen is recovered, ensuring the Chapter's future.
Narthecium.rawXML:
<narthecium cooldown="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</narthecium>
Narthecium.name: Narthecium

Orbital Deployment.description: Deploys the unit from a city tile to the target tile.
Orbital Deployment.flavor: Some units make their way to battle via tunnelling, teleportation, flying or some other extraordinary means which allows them to appear in the thick of the fighting.
Orbital Deployment.name: Orbital Deployment

Power Strike.description: Performs a Power Sword attack with increased damage.
Power Strike.flavor:
“My sword is at the Emperor's command. I answer to no other man, living or dead.”
  — Tu'shan, Chapter Master of the Salamanders
