Power Strike.rawXML:
<powerStrike cooldown="3" icon="Actions/PowerStrike" rank="-1" rankMax="2" weaponSlotName="PowerSword">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<damage mulMin="0.5" mulMax="1.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</powerStrike>
Power Strike.name: Power Strike

Healing Surge.flavor:
“I haven't lost an arm, brother. It's right over there.”
  — Captain Alessio Cortez, Crimson Fists
Healing Surge.rawXML:
<healingSurge cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.15" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<damaged/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax addMin="0.2" addMax="0.4"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</healingSurge>
Healing Surge.name: Healing Surge

Deeds of Glory.description: When gaining experience from combat the chapter gains influence.
Deeds of Glory.flavor:
“It is a captain's duty to place legionary lives in harm's way before his own. There is too little glory in the galaxy to go around and officers must be generous in the trust they place in others—for one day such brothers must be captains too.”
  — Rouboute Guilliman, Primarch of the Ultramarines, Lord Commander and Imperial Regent
Deeds of Glory.rawXML:
<deedsOfGlory passive="1" levelUpPriority="0.2" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="DeedsOfGlory"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</deedsOfGlory>
Deeds of Glory.name: Deeds of Glory

Orbital Strike.description: Operation that bombards the target enemy unit.
Orbital Strike.flavor:
“No Exterminatus Extremis order is carried out lightly. To order the death of a planet by Virus Bomb, Cyclonic Torpedo or Atmospheric Incinerator, one must be certain of one's intent. One must accept that millions, even billions, will die so that the rest of humanity may live.”
  — Lord High Admiral Soheil, at the scouring of Colchis
Orbital Strike.rawXML:
<orbitalBombardment cooldown="3" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/OrbitalBombardment">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="OrbitalBombardment"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</orbitalBombardment>
Orbital Strike.name: Orbital Strike

Rites of War.description: Increases the damage of the Chaplain and adjacent allied units.
Rites of War.flavor: Honour-bound by sacred oaths of fealty to the Imperium, the Chaplain and his warriors vow before the Chapter and the Emperor to secure victory at any cost.
Rites of War.rawXML:
<ritesOfWar cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="RitesOfWar"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</ritesOfWar>
Rites of War.name: Rites of War

Canticles of Wrath.description: Restores the morale of this unit and adjacent allied units and reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units.
Canticles of Wrath.flavor: Amplified through his vox grill, the Chaplain's bellicose rhetoric and canticles of wrath echo like thunder across the battlefield, filling the Space Marines with new strength while causing the enemy to cower in terror.
Canticles of Wrath.rawXML:
<canticlesOfWrath cooldown="3" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="2" addMax="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="-2" addMax="-6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</canticlesOfWrath>
Canticles of Wrath.name: Canticles of Wrath

Dogma Astartes.description: Increases the loyalty output of the fortress-city.
Dogma Astartes.flavor: The Chaplains of the Space Marines are grim spiritual guardians, whose first duty is to be ever watchful for the dangers of pride, doubt and heresy. Daunting even to their own brethren, Chaplains rely on dogma and liturgy to keep their brothers from spiritual corruption.
Dogma Astartes.rawXML:
<dogmaAstrates passive="1" levelUpPriority="0.5" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="DogmaAstrates"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</dogmaAstrates>
Dogma Astartes.name: Dogma Astartes

Oration of Restoration.description: Restores the hitpoints of the Chaplain and adjacent allied units each turn.
Oration of Restoration.flavor:
“At battle's end, speak the Liturgy in a clear voice. Respect the bravery of the living. Give the Rite of Passage to the fallen. Honour the battle gear of the dead. To do all this with reverence, even when exhausted by battle and weary from the field, is the duty of a Chaplain. It is his burden and satisfaction.”
  — Adeptus Astartes, The Book of Faith
Oration of Restoration.rawXML:
<orationOfRestoration cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="OrationOfRestoration"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</orationOfRestoration>
Oration of Restoration.name: Oration of Restoration

Omniscope.flavor: Centurions make use of omniscopes to better direct their fearsome firepower and pierce the gloom of a hostile galaxy.
Omniscope.rawXML:
<signum cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SpaceMarines/Omniscope" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/Omniscope">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SpaceMarines/Omniscope"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</signum>
Omniscope.name: Omniscope

Signum.description: Negates the penalty for heavy, ordnance and salvo weapons.
Signum.flavor: The signum is a communication device that quickly processes and broadcasts targeting data. This ancient piece of technology allows one member of a Space Marine squad to fire with even greater accuracy, battering vital targets with a hail of unerring shots.
Signum.rawXML:
<signum cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/Signum">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Relentless"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</signum>
Signum.name: Signum

Power of the Machine Spirit.flavor: The interface between this vehicle's advanced machine spirit and its fire control mechanisms allows the crew to target foes with incredible accuracy.
modifiers: Power of the Machine Spirit (1 turn)
Power of the Machine Spirit.rawXML:
<powerOfTheMachineSpirit consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" cooldown="5">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="PowerOfTheMachineSpirit"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</powerOfTheMachineSpirit>
Power of the Machine Spirit.name: Power of the Machine Spirit

Objuration Mechanicum.description: Curses the ranged weaponry of the target enemy unit. Also deals damage if the target is a vehicle or a fortification.
Objuration Mechanicum.flavor: Weapons jam and engines seize up as the telekine uses his powers to wrench and twist the inner workings at the hearts of nearby machines.
Objuration Mechanicum.rawXML:
<objurationMechanicum cooldown="2" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit match="Any">
											<trait name="Fortification"/>
											<trait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="-6" addMax="-18"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="GetsHot"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</objurationMechanicum>
Objuration Mechanicum.name: Objuration Mechanicum

Shockwave.flavor: The psyker slams his palms together and the noise is magnified a hundredfold, releasing a shockwave that snaps bones and knocks foes from their feet.
Shockwave.rawXML:
<shockwave cooldown="2" levelUpPriority="0.2" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<attacks mulMin="0.33" mulMax="1.0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="Shockwave"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</shockwave>
Shockwave.name: Shockwave

Levitate.description: Flies across obstacles to the target tile.
Levitate.flavor: The psyker uses his telekinetic powers to launch himself skywards, leaping across the battlefield in a single bound.
Levitate.rawXML:
<levitate cooldownMin="3" cooldownMax="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<movement add="1"/>
						<movementMax add="1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</levitate>
Levitate.name: Levitate

Telekine Dome.description: Creates a barrier on the tile of the Librarian and adjacent tiles that increases the ranged damage reduction.
Telekine Dome.flavor: Bullets bounce off of thin air and are deflected harmlessly away as the psyker erects a barrier of shimmering energy about himself.
Telekine Dome.rawXML:
<telekineDome cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="0.3" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="TelekineDome"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier visible="0">
									<effects>
										<addFeature duration="3" name="TelekineDome"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</telekineDome>
Telekine Dome.name: Telekine Dome

Cluster Mines.description: Places cluster mines on the target adjacent tile to slow and damage enemies.
Cluster Mines.flavor: While operating behind enemy lines, Scout Bikers carry cluster mines—explosive devices crammed with tiny anti-personnel bomblets and triggered by tripwires or pressure sensors.
Cluster Mines.rawXML:
<clusterMines consumedMovement="0" cooldown="5" icon="Weapons/ClusterMines" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/ClusterMines">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyUnit/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addFeature name="ClusterMines"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</clusterMines>
Cluster Mines.name: Cluster Mines

Vectored Afterburners.description: Increases the movement and ranged damage reduction.
Vectored Afterburners.rawXML:
<vectoredAfterburners consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="VectoredAfterburners"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</vectoredAfterburners>
Vectored Afterburners.name: Vectored Afterburners

Bolster Defences.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of the target tile.
Bolster Defences.flavor:
“Every position must be held to the last man: there must be no retirement. With our backs to the wall, and believing in the justice of our cause, each one of us must fight on to the end.”
  — Imperial Warmaster Solon
Bolster Defences.name: Bolster Defences

Bonding Knife Ritual.flavor: Many T'au groupings undergo the solemn and bloody ceremony known as the ta'lissera. Those teams that share this bond swear to support one another at all costs for the rest of their lives.
Bonding Knife Ritual.rawXML:
<bondingKnifeRitual cooldown="10" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Tau/BondingKnifeRitual" requiredUpgrade="Tau/BondingKnifeRitual">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<morale add="100"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</bondingKnifeRitual>
Bonding Knife Ritual.name: Bonding Knife Ritual

Deploy %1%.rawXML:
<deployFortress cooldown="10" cooldownScalesWithPace="1" icon="Actions/DeployFortressOfRedemption" scaleInfluenceCost="1" unit="SpaceMarines/FortressOfRedemption">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Resource"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</deployFortress>
Deploy %1%.name: Deploy %1%

Repair.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle, fortification or T'au unit.
Repair.flavor: For the Tyranids, it may be a slick of healing enzymes and symbiotes. For the Orks, a welding torch and WAAAGH! Power. For the T’au, hard advanced science. But every race has some capability for fixing the damage caused by combat and by the hostile world of Gladius Prime.
Repair.rawXML:
<repair cooldown="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<faction name="Tau"/>
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</repair>
Repair.name: Repair

Construct Tidewall Gunrig.description: Heavily armed fortification that can be moved by transporting troops.
Construct Tidewall Gunrig.flavor: With its in-built rail weaponry, the Tidewall Gunrig provides the firepower to deal with heavy enemy assault units or advancing ranks of armour. Manned by hard-eyed Fire Warriors, these mobile turrets mount devastating railguns that are more than capable of ripping apart enemy tanks or monstrous beasts with volleys of hyper-sonic rounds.
Construct Tidewall Gunrig.rawXML:
<constructTidewallGunrig cooldown="10" icon="Units/Tau/TidewallGunrig" requiredUpgrade="Tau/TidewallGunrig">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<energyCost base="40"/>
						<oreCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Tau/TidewallGunrig"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</constructTidewallGunrig>
Construct Tidewall Gunrig.name: Construct Tidewall Gunrig

Markerlight.description: Increases the ranged accuracy of T'au against the target enemy non-fortification unit. Reduces the ranged damage reduction of the target enemy non-fortification unit against T'au. Ends after the target enemy unit is attacked by T'au.
Markerlight.flavor: A markerlight is a hand-held device that projects a simple beam onto a target which then transmits a torrent of targeting data to other T'au units, allowing them to engage the target with unerring accuracy.
Markerlight.rawXML:
<markerlight cooldown="1" name="Tau/Markerlight">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2" lineOfSight="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</markerlight>
Markerlight.name: Markerlight

Volley Fire.description: Increases the ranged attacks of this unit and adjacent allied infantry units that have not moved.
Volley Fire.flavor: Under the constant eye of their Tutor, Fire Caste units learn to take cover, wait for the right moment and fire as one. The resulting volley of pulsed energy hits like neon fireworks and can thoroughly demoralize enemies.
Volley Fire.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" name="Tau/VolleyFire">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/VolleyFire"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Volley Fire.name: Volley Fire

Break Composure.description: This unit and adjacent allied infantry units cause attacked units to lose morale.
Break Composure.flavor: Though not physically impressive, the T’au can inculcate fear in their enemies through subtler means—by harrying them so that they can’t focus, by surrounding them, by forcing them down tactical paths that only lead to repeated failure. Sometimes you don’t need to even touch an enemy to defeat them.
Break Composure.rawXML:
<breakComposure cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/BreakComposure">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/BreakComposure"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</breakComposure>
Break Composure.name: Break Composure

Precise Shot.description: Performs an uncompromising Pulse Rifle attack with increased accuracy, damage and range.
Precise Shot.flavor:
“I’m not going to teach you a special deathblow. I’m not going to give you a bigger gun. I’m not going to surround you with magic shield drones willing to die for you. But I am going to teach you to shoot straight, under fire, together. That immediately makes you better than every last Gue’la.”
  — Tutor Sharptongue
Precise Shot.rawXML:
<preciseShot cooldown="3" icon="Actions/Tau/PreciseShot" rank="-1" rankMax="2" weaponSlotName="PulseRifle" name="Tau/PreciseShot">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<accuracy mulMin="0.5" mulMax="1.5"/>
						<damage mulMin="0.5" mulMax="1.5"/>
						<rangeMax mulMin="0.5" mulMax="1.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</preciseShot>
Precise Shot.name: Precise Shot

Unity.description: Increases the loyalty output of all cities.
Unity.flavor: Though the Commanders are the icons of T’au propaganda, it is the Fireblades who are quietly regarded as the true heroes—warriors good enough to don Battle Suits who choose instead to stay with the rank and file, training them for the Greater Good. They are the true inspirations.
Unity.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" name="Tau/Unity">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/Unity"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Unity.name: Unity

Mont'ka (Killing Blow).description: Metastrategy that increases the damage of allied T'au units in the area against enemy units below 50% hitpoints. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.
Mont'ka (Killing Blow).flavor:
“Your enemy builds his force carefully. At its centre, lie his core units. You feign weakness. You draw them out. And you focus your fire on them. Without them, the enemy is lost. Cut off the head, the beast dies. Well, except for Be’gel.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Mont'ka (Killing Blow).rawXML:
<montka cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/Montka">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tau/Ripyka"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tau/RipykaVa"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>	
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/Montka"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/Kauyon"/>
				<action name="Tau/Rinyon"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</montka>
Mont'ka (Killing Blow).name: Mont'ka (Killing Blow)

Kauyon (Patient Hunter).description: Metastrategy that increases the ranged damage reduction of allied T'au units in the area. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.
Kauyon (Patient Hunter).flavor:
“Your troops are losing. They fall back! They flee! The enemy pursues, hungry for our valourous blood! Everything is lost… then your troops turn and fire. You reveal the flanking troops. And your enemy is in a pocket, encircled. The patient hunter triumphs.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Kauyon (Patient Hunter).rawXML:
<kauyon cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/Kauyon">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tau/Ripyka"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tau/RipykaVa"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/Kauyon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/Montka"/>
				<action name="Tau/Rinyon"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</kauyon>
Kauyon (Patient Hunter).name: Kauyon (Patient Hunter)

Rinyon (Circle of Blades).description: Metastrategy that increases the accuracy of allied T'au units in the area against enemy units adjacent to other allied units. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.
Rinyon (Circle of Blades).flavor:
“Your enemy encircles you. His troops are close. Too close. Your targeting network assigns every Fire Caste a victim, not his neighbour. You fire as one, every shot strikes, they fall as one. A distracted enemy is as good as dead.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Rinyon (Circle of Blades).rawXML:
<rinyon cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/Rinyon">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tau/Ripyka"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tau/RipykaVa"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/Rinyon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/Kauyon"/>
				<action name="Tau/Montka"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</rinyon>
Rinyon (Circle of Blades).name: Rinyon (Circle of Blades)

Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).description: Reduces the cooldown of the Commander's metastrategies.
Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).flavor:
“The enemy’s armour is thick, your blade makes only a scratch. In his arrogance, he allows you to strike. Hit the same spot, ten, a hundred, a thousand times. That scratch becomes a dent becomes a hole becomes his death. Water erodes the stone.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" name="Tau/Ripyka">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/Ripyka"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).name: Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers)

Sense of Stone.description: Increases the damage reduction of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures. Shares cooldown with Storm of Fire.
Sense of Stone.flavor:
“There are only four thoughts the Fire Caste must know. Knowing when to hide. Knowing when to defend. Knowing when to mislead. And knowing when to strike. Ask nothing more.”
  — Aun’Dak’E, Curator of Spirit
Sense of Stone.rawXML:
<senseOfStone cooldown="1" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/SenseOfStone">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait durationMin="1" durationMax="3" name="Tau/SenseOfStone"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/StormOfFire"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</senseOfStone>
Sense of Stone.name: Sense of Stone

Storm of Fire.description: Increases the attacks of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures. Shares cooldown with Sense of Stone.
Storm of Fire.flavor:
“It burns so briefly, the light of my children, so briefly. But, by the Greater Good, it burns so bright!”
  — Aun’Va, Master of the Undying Spirit
Storm of Fire.rawXML:
<stormOfFire cooldown="1" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/StormOfFire">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait durationMin="1" durationMax="3" name="Tau/StormOfFire"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/SenseOfStone"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</stormOfFire>
Storm of Fire.name: Storm of Fire

Calm of Tides.description: Restores the hitpoints of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures.
Calm of Tides.flavor:
“Wait a moment. Breathe. Do not hurry to their salvation. All will come to the T’au eventually. Alive or dead.”
  — Aun’Dak’E, Curator of Spirit
Calm of Tides.rawXML:
<calmOfTides cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" name="Tau/CalmOfTides">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="4" addMax="12"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</calmOfTides>
Calm of Tides.name: Calm of Tides

Zephyr's Grace.description: Increases the action points of this unit and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures.
Zephyr's Grace.flavor:
“Let none doubt that the Tau Empire will bring unity to all – let none doubt that now is our time. Forward, for the Greater Good!”
  — Aun’Va, Master of the Undying Spirit
Zephyr's Grace.rawXML:
<zephyrsGrace cooldown="10" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" name="Tau/ZephyrsGrace">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/ZephyrsGrace"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</zephyrsGrace>
Zephyr's Grace.name: Zephyr's Grace

Holophoton Countermeasures.description: Decreases the ranged accuracy of target enemy unit.
Holophoton Countermeasures.flavor: Triggered by AI-assisted threat-warning protocols, holophoton countermeasures take the form of a targeted barrage of holo-decoys, friendly target simulacra and stroboscopic blasts. Enemy weapons are confounded, safety-switches engaging and machine spirits rebelling while their operators are left bewildered and blinded by the overwhelming sensory overload.
Holophoton Countermeasures.rawXML:
<holophotonCountermeasures cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Tau/HolophotonCountermeasures">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Tau/HolophotonCountermeasures"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/HolophotonCountermeasures" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</holophotonCountermeasures>
Holophoton Countermeasures.name: Holophoton Countermeasures

Gravity Wave Projector.description: Prevents unit movement on target tile.
Gravity Wave Projector.flavor: This projector emits a high-powered graviton wave that repulses nearby enemies, slowing their advance to a crawl.
Gravity Wave Projector.rawXML:
<gravityWaveProjector cooldown="1" name="Tau/GravityWaveProjector">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addFeature duration="1" name="GravityWaves"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</gravityWaveProjector>
Gravity Wave Projector.name: Gravity Wave Projector

Pulse Accelerator.description: Increases the range of pulse weapons of target allied unit.
Pulse Accelerator.flavor: This device emits a powerful induction field that accelerates the charges of pulse weapons, increasing their range.
Pulse Accelerator.rawXML:
<pulseAccelerator cooldown="1" name="Tau/PulseAccelerator">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<noTrait name="Tau/PulseAccelerator"/>
						</unit>
						<weapon match="Any">
							<type name="PulseDriverCannon"/>
							<type name="PulseRifle"/>
							<type name="PulseSubmunitionsCannon"/>
							<type name="TwinLinkedPulseCarbine"/>
						</weapon>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/PulseAccelerator"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</pulseAccelerator>
Pulse Accelerator.name: Pulse Accelerator

Nova Shield.description: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the damage reduction.
Nova Shield.flavor: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.
Nova Shield.rawXML:
<novaShield consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="2" name="Tau/NovaShield">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="-0.1"/>
										<addTrait name="Tau/NovaShield" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/NovaBoost"/>
				<action name="Tau/NovaFire"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</novaShield>
Nova Shield.name: Nova Shield

Nova Boost.description: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the movement.
Nova Boost.flavor: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.
Nova Boost.rawXML:
<novaBoost consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="2" name="Tau/NovaBoost">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="-0.1"/>
										<addTrait name="Tau/NovaBoost" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/NovaFire"/>
				<action name="Tau/NovaShield"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</novaBoost>
Nova Boost.name: Nova Boost

Nova Fire.description: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the attacks.
Nova Fire.flavor: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.
Nova Fire.rawXML:
<novaFire consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="2" name="Tau/NovaFire">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="-0.1"/>
										<addTrait name="Tau/NovaFire" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/NovaBoost"/>
				<action name="Tau/NovaShield"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</novaFire>
Nova Fire.name: Nova Fire

Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.description: Sacrifices hitpoints to do a special attack that targets adjacent enemies and allies alike.
Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.flavor: The experimental Nova Reactors are only used on a handful of Battlesuit designs. Damage cannot be avoided from their use, but sometimes they must be employed for the Greater Good to supercharge offensive or defensive weapon systems—or, as here, to render the Battlesuit’s local area utterly lethal with a burst of raw power.
Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.rawXML:
<novaElectromagneticShockwave consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="2" name="Tau/NovaElectromagneticShockwave">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="-0.1"/>
										<weaponDamage weapon="NovaElectromagneticShockwave"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/NovaBoost"/>
				<action name="Tau/NovaFire"/>
				<action name="Tau/NovaShield"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</novaElectromagneticShockwave>
Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.name: Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave

Project Shield.description: Increases the damage reduction of target allied unit.
Project Shield.flavor: Projecting a powerful counter-ballistic force field, Shield Drones protect their operators from harm.
Project Shield.rawXML:
<projectShield cooldown="1" name="Tau/ProjectShield">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<noTrait name="Shielded"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Shielded"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</projectShield>
Project Shield.name: Project Shield

Stealth Field.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of target allied unit.
Stealth Field.flavor: Some Drones are harder to produce than others. The MV5 Stealth Drone is one such, carrying a stealth field generator and only ever deployed in pairs alongside the rare XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuit. Given how long these infiltrators spend alone behind enemy lines, Ghostkeel pilots typically develop a strong relationship with their MV5s and Battlesuit.
Stealth Field.rawXML:
<stealthField cooldown="1" name="Tau/StealthField">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<noTrait name="Shrouded"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Shrouded"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</stealthField>
Stealth Field.name: Stealth Field

Spore Burst.flavor: As the Spore Mine is flung through the air, its internal gas bladder inflates and it floats down towards ground level. Even if the shot misses its initial target, the danger it poses is far from over; for the Spore Mine is possessed of a rudimentary intelligence and detonates not on impact with the ground, but when it senses the proximity of a non-Tyranid life form.
Spore Burst.rawXML:
<sporeMine cooldown="5" icon="Units/Tyranids/SporeMine" name="Tyranids/SporeMine">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Tyranids/SporeMine" consumedAction="0" consumedMovement="0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</sporeMine>
Spore Burst.name: Spore Burst

Override Instinctive Behaviour.description: Focuses the Hive mind's attention to temporarily override instinctive behaviour.
Override Instinctive Behaviour.flavor: Unless controlled or coordinated by the domineering will of the Hive Mind, many Tyranid organisms will revert to their baser instincts.
Override Instinctive Behaviour.rawXML:
<instinctiveBehaviourOverride consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" name="Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride2">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride" duration="3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</instinctiveBehaviourOverride>
Override Instinctive Behaviour.name: Override Instinctive Behaviour

Subterranean Assault.description: Tunnels from a Trygon's Broodhive to another Broodhive.
Subterranean Assault.flavor:
“How ironic it is that as fast as we spread progress and hope throughout the galaxy, the Tyranids spread death and despair. Only united can we hope to stand against them.”
  — Aun'shi of the T'au Empire
Subterranean Assault.name: Subterranean Assault

Living Battering Ram.flavor: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.
Living Battering Ram.rawXML:
<hammerOfWrath consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" name="Tyranids/LivingBatteringRam" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/LivingBatteringRam" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</hammerOfWrath>
Living Battering Ram.name: Living Battering Ram

Synapse Creature.description: Grants this and adjacent units immunity to morale, fear and instinctive behaviour effects.
Synapse Creature.flavor: Some Tyranids serve as synaptic conduits or nodal relays through which a portion of the Hive Mind's iron will flows, overriding the natural instincts of the swarm.
Synapse Creature.name: Synapse Creature

Shadow In The Warp.description: Reduces the morale of adjacent enemy psyker units each turn.
Shadow In The Warp.flavor: The unfathomable presence of the Hive Mind radiates out from its synapse creatures, smothering the ability of the psykers who stand before them to draw upon their mystic powers.
Shadow In The Warp.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Tyranids/ShadowInTheWarp" passive="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/ShadowInTheWarp"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Shadow In The Warp.name: Shadow In The Warp

The Horror.description: Reduces the movement and ranged accuracy, increases the ranged damage reduction and prevents the target enemy infantry unit from doing overwatch attacks.
The Horror.flavor: The terrifying psychic presence of the Hive Mind radiates from the synapse creature, flooding the minds of the Tyranids' enemies and causing them to quail and panic.
The Horror.rawXML:
<theHorror cooldown="1" name="Tyranids/TheHorror" psychicPower="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
							<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="Pinned"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</theHorror>
The Horror.name: The Horror

Paroxysm.description: Reduces the accuracy of the target enemy unit.
Paroxysm.flavor: The Hive Mind debilitates its enemies by triggering every nerve and pain receptor in their bodies, overwhelming their senses with wracking fits of agony.
Paroxysm.rawXML:
<paroxysm cooldown="1" name="Tyranids/Paroxysm" psychicPower="1" requiredUpgrade="Tyranids/Paroxysm">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="Tyranids/Paroxysm"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</paroxysm>
Paroxysm.name: Paroxysm

Rapacious Hunger.flavor: To see a Haruspex in a full feeding frenzy is to recognise your life is already lost—not in the creature's jetbike-sized maw necessarily, but to what the Haruspex symbolises. These creatures are normally only deployed at the end of a planetary invasion—so to see them is to accept that your planet is almost certainly doomed.
Rapacious Hunger.rawXML:
<rapaciousHunger consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" name="Tyranids/RapaciousHunger" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/RapaciousHunger" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</rapaciousHunger>
Rapacious Hunger.name: Rapacious Hunger

Indescribable Horror.description: The Hive Tyrant reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units each turn.
Indescribable Horror.flavor:
“We cannot live through this. Mankind cannot live through this. In a single day they have covered the surface of this planet with a flood of living blades and needle-fanged mouths. Kill one and ten take its place. If they are truly without number then our race is doomed to a violent death before every shred of our civilization is scoured away by a force more voracious than the fires of hell themselves! Death! By the Machine God, Death is here!”
  — Magos Varnak, Overseer of the Tyran research station
Indescribable Horror.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Tyranids/IndescribableHorror" passive="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" excludeRadius="0" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/IndescribableHorror"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Indescribable Horror.name: Indescribable Horror

Psychic Scream.flavor: Through its vassal, the Hive Mind unleashes a piercing shriek of undiluted psychic energy that shreds the minds of those caught in the wake.
Psychic Scream.rawXML:
<psychicScream cooldown="2" name="Tyranids/PsychicScream" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<damage mulMin="0.0" mulMax="1.0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="PsychicScream"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</psychicScream>
Psychic Scream.name: Psychic Scream

Onslaught.description: Increases the movement of the Hive Tyrant and adjacent allied units.
Onslaught.flavor: The synapse creature reaches out its mind and seizes control of the lesser creatures' weapon symbiotes, guiding their fire whilst simultaneously driving the swarms towards the enemy at a breakneck pace.
Onslaught.rawXML:
<onslaught consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" name="Tyranids/Onslaught" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<movement greater="0"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/Onslaught" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</onslaught>
Onslaught.name: Onslaught

Dominion.description: Increases the Synapse Link radius and the loyalty output of all cities.
Dominion.flavor: The Tyranid uses its prodigious psychic strength to channel and amplify the will of the Hive Mind.
Dominion.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Tyranids/Dominion" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radiusMin="2" radiusMax="4">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/Dominion"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Dominion.name: Dominion

Hive Commander.description: The Hive Tyrant increases the damage and damage reduction of allied Tyranid units in the area.
Hive Commander.flavor:
“A new Tyrant joined the fray and, in an eyeblink, the whole character of the swarm changed. The ravening berserker-spirit that had driven the Tyranids onto the ridge was gone as if it had never existed. Left in its place was something cannier and infinitely more worrisome. It was then that I knew the battle to be lost.”
  — Sergeant Torias Telion, Ultramarines 10th Company
Hive Commander.rawXML:
<hiveCommander consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" elite="1" name="Tyranids/HiveCommander" rank="-1" rankMax="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tyranids"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/HiveCommander" duration="3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</hiveCommander>
Hive Commander.name: Hive Commander

Clear Tile (Tyranids).description: Clears the tile of wire weed, holy sites, imperial ruins, and forests, one at a time.
Clear Tile (Tyranids).name: Clear Tile (Tyranids)

Consume Tile.description: Feeds upon the planet, consuming the tile's biomass, clearing forests and turning the ground into bedrock.
Consume Tile.flavor: Rippers are experts at gathering biomass material of all sorts—but it takes heavier Tyranid support units, co-ordinated by a Malanthrope, to strip a planet of all its resources, leaving only bedrock behind.
Consume Tile.rawXML:
<consumeTile icon="Features/Bedrock" name="Tyranids/ConsumeTile" costScalesWithPace="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="30"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Tyranids/ConsumeTile2">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.25"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noEnemyPlayer/>
							<noEnemyUnit/>
							<noFeature name="Bedrock"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<consumeResources/>
										<removeFeature name="Brush"/>
										<removeFeature name="Forest"/>
										<removeFeature name="LightBrush"/>
										<removeFeature name="OrkoidFungus"/>
										<addFeature name="Bedrock"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</consumeTile>
Consume Tile.name: Consume Tile

Grasping Tail.description: Reduces the attacks of the target enemy unit.
Grasping Tail.flavor: If a Malanthrope must engage in battle, it makes for a difficult foe. Its sinuous body is hard to strike, its grasping tail can immobilise foes or their weapons, and its feeder tendrils are highly poisonous, causing excruciating pain. If a foe becomes paralysed by its tendrils, the Malanthrope will begin to absorb it alive, to acquire the choicest, freshest genetic data.
Grasping Tail.rawXML:
<graspingTail cooldown="3" name="Tyranids/GraspingTail">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/GraspingTail" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</graspingTail>
Grasping Tail.name: Grasping Tail

Spore Cloud.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of this unit and adjacent allied units.
Spore Cloud.flavor: The best possible tactic against Tyranids is decapitation—namely, the execution of the synapse creatures that relay the Norn Queen's commands. Unfortunately, through the fluid mass of sinuous flesh that constitutes a Tyranid assault, the hail of acidic and living projectiles, and the obfuscating spore clouds, even a Vindicare assassin would have trouble picking out a Dominatrix, let alone a Tyrant.
Spore Cloud.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Tyranids/SporeCloud" passive="1" enabled="0" visible="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/SporeCloud"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud

Diffusion Field.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of adjacent allied tyranid units.
Diffusion Field.flavor: In other theatres of war, genetors have noted that the thick cloud of spores emitted by Venomthropes obscure the sight of their enemies. The strain of Maleceptor on Gladius Prime has a similar diffusive effect on enemy attacks, albeit caused by the shadowy tendrils emanating from its encephalic tissue and their direct interference with the consciousness of the opposing troops.
Diffusion Field.rawXML:
<diffusionField cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tyranids/DiffusionField" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tyranids"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tyranids/DiffusionField"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</diffusionField>
Diffusion Field.name: Diffusion Field

Living Incubator.flavor: A foe engaging a Tervigon up close will find itself assailed by waves of skittering Termagants. Such a confrontation is terrible to behold, for a Tervigon's capacity to reinforce is vast, and its broods are driven into a near-frenzy by the need to protect their progenitor.
Living Incubator.rawXML:
<livingIncubator cooldown="3" name="Tyranids/LivingIncubator" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tyranids/MassIncubation"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Tyranids/Termagant" consumedAction="0" consumedMovement="0" levelMin="0" levelMax="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</livingIncubator>
Living Incubator.name: Living Incubator

Catalyst.description: Restores the hitpoints of the Tervigon and target allied Tyranids unit.
Catalyst.flavor: Through its synaptic conduits, the power of the Hive Mind reaches out to infuse the organisms under its control, invigorating their systems with such unnatural vitality that they can ignore the most grievous of wounds.
Catalyst.rawXML:
<catalyst cooldown="1" name="Tyranids/Catalyst" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<faction name="Tyranids"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="4" addMax="12"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="4" addMax="12"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</catalyst>
Catalyst.name: Catalyst

Brood Progenitor.description: Increases the attacks of allied Termagants.
Brood Progenitor.flavor:
“This horror, this abomination, has thought and purpose that functions on an unimaginable, galactic scale and all we can do is try to stop the swarms of bioengineered monsters it unleashes upon us by instinct. We have given the horror a name to salve our fears; we call it the Tyranid race, but if it is aware of us at all it must know us only as Prey.”
  — Inquisitor Czevak
Brood Progenitor.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Tyranids/BroodProgenitor" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radiusMin="1" radiusMax="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/BroodProgenitor"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Brood Progenitor.name: Brood Progenitor

Mass Incubation.description: Reduces the cooldown of Living Incubator.
Mass Incubation.flavor: Should a Tervigon need it, it can birth its entire brood rapidly. An opponent focused on this single opponent may find itself suddenly outnumbered.
Mass Incubation.rawXML:
<massIncubation consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" elite="1" name="Tyranids/MassIncubation" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/MassIncubation" duration="3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</massIncubation>
Mass Incubation.name: Mass Incubation

Construct Broodhive.flavor: Where the Tyranids arrive, the plants that constitute the Broodhive travel with them. Rapidly proliferating from seeds left by the Tyranid swarm as they pass, these plants burrow their giant hollow roots through soil, metal or stone, enabling Tyranids to pass undetected between areas.
Construct Broodhive.rawXML:
<constructImperialStrongpoint cooldown="5" icon="Units/Tyranids/Tunnel" name="Tyranids/ConstructTunnel">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<biomassCost base="20"/>
						<influenceCost base="10"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Resource"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Tyranids/Tunnel"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</constructImperialStrongpoint>
Construct Broodhive.name: Construct Broodhive

Scourge of the Brood.description: The Tyranid Prime increases its damage.
Scourge of the Brood.flavor:
“As I looked into its dead black eyes, I saw the terrible sentience it had in place of a soul. Behind that was the steel will of its leader. Further still I could feel its primogenitor coldly assessing me from the void. And looking back from the deepest recesses of the alien's mind I perceived what I can only describe as an immortal hunger.”
  — Chief Librarian Varro Tigurius of the Ultramarines
Scourge of the Brood.rawXML:
<scourgeOfTheBrood consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" name="Tyranids/ScourgeOfTheBrood" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/ScourgeOfTheBrood" duration="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</scourgeOfTheBrood>
Scourge of the Brood.name: Scourge of the Brood

Adaptive Biology.description: Increases the feel no pain damage reduction for the turn after taking damage.
Adaptive Biology.flavor: This hero has been created to adapt against the weaponry used by the current prey world's defenders.
Adaptive Biology.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Tyranids/AdaptiveBiology" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/AdaptiveBiology"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Adaptive Biology.name: Adaptive Biology

Alpha Warrior.description: Increases the accuracy of allied Tyranid Warriors in range.
Alpha Warrior.flavor:
“To think that Tyranids are mindless beasts is a grave mistake. When you fight Tyranids you face not only those before you on the battlefield, but the untold thousands which seek to surround you, which attack your supporting units and destroy your supply lines in perfect synchronicity.”
  — Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines
Alpha Warrior.rawXML:
<genericUnitAbility name="Tyranids/AlphaWarrior" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radiusMin="1" radiusMax="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/AlphaWarrior"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>
Alpha Warrior.name: Alpha Warrior

Exploit Weaknesses.description: The Tyranid Prime reduces the armour of the target enemy unit.
Exploit Weaknesses.flavor:
“We retreat, we fall back, we make strategic withdrawals, we consolidate, we evacuate. When in the name of all that's holy are we going to fight back?”
  — Commissar General Vortigus Hornth, Acting Warmaster; Diatan Sector, Ultima Segmentum
Exploit Weaknesses.rawXML:
<exploitWeaknesses consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" elite="1" name="Tyranids/ExploitWeaknesses" rank="-1" rankMax="0" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tyranids/ExploitWeaknesses" duration="3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</exploitWeaknesses>
Exploit Weaknesses.name: Exploit Weaknesses

Power Surge.description: Increases the ouput of non-headquarters buildings on the target tile.
Power Surge.flavor:
“Throw open the transonic oscillator and escalate the dereactor another three points. I require those forges running at optimal efficiency!”
—Archmagos Dyatskin, shortly before the loss of Arklis Hive Primus
Power Surge.rawXML:
<powerSurge cooldown="6" name="AdeptusMechanicus/PowerSurge">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/BlessedConduits">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<affiliatedCity/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="AdeptusMechanicus/PowerSurge" duration="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</powerSurge>
Power Surge.name: Power Surge

Litany of the Electromancer.description: Damages target enemy unit. Attacks and cost scales with the amount of Canticles of the Omnissiah units (up to 10).
Litany of the Electromancer.flavor: Summoning the spark of the Machine God’s divinity that burns within them, the Omnissiah’s faithful manifest blazing auras of energy that lay low the unbeliever.
Litany of the Electromancer.rawXML:
<litanyOfTheElectromancer cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/LitanyOfTheElectromancer" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/LitanyOfTheElectromancer" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<attacks mulMin="0.0" mulMax="9.0"/>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="LitanyOfTheElectromancer"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</litanyOfTheElectromancer>
Litany of the Electromancer.name: Litany of the Electromancer

Chant of the Remorseless Fist.description: Increases the melee accuracy of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Chant of the Remorseless Fist.flavor: In spitting out a staccato chant to the Motive Force, the faithful warriors of the Cult Mechanicus are filled with merciless surety as well as intent.
modifiers: Chant of the Remorseless Fist (1 turn)
Chant of the Remorseless Fist.rawXML:
<canticle cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/ChantOfTheRemorselessFist" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ChantOfTheRemorselessFist" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/ChantOfTheRemorselessFist" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/CanticlesOfTheOmnissiah"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ChantOfTheRemorselessFist"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</canticle>
Chant of the Remorseless Fist.name: Chant of the Remorseless Fist

Benediction of Omniscience.description: Increases the ranged accuracy of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Benediction of Omniscience.flavor: Those blessed enough to comprehend this blaring vox-prayer find their targeting reticules guided by the Omnissiah’s own vigilance.
Benediction of Omniscience.rawXML:
<canticle cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/BenedictionOfOmniscience" name="AdeptusMechanicus/BenedictionOfOmniscience" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/BenedictionOfOmniscience" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/CanticlesOfTheOmnissiah"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/BenedictionOfOmniscience"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</canticle>
Benediction of Omniscience.name: Benediction of Omniscience

Shroudpsalm.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Shroudpsalm.flavor: Robot, servitor and priest shift their binharic emissions into the visible spectra, the static pouring from their vox-grilles manifesting as an electromagnetic storm that hides them from the foe.
Shroudpsalm.rawXML:
<canticle cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/Shroudpsalm" name="AdeptusMechanicus/Shroudpsalm" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/Shroudpsalm" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/CanticlesOfTheOmnissiah"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/Shroudpsalm"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</canticle>
Shroudpsalm.name: Shroudpsalm

Invocation of Machine-Might.description: Increases the melee damage of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Invocation of Machine-Might.flavor: The Tech-Priests lead their minions in a binharic prayer that sends miraculous strength surging through tendons, wires and pistons.
Invocation of Machine-Might.rawXML:
<canticle cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/InvocationOfMachineMight" name="AdeptusMechanicus/InvocationOfMachineMight" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/InvocationOfMachineMight" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/CanticlesOfTheOmnissiah"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/InvocationOfMachineMight"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</canticle>
Invocation of Machine-Might.name: Invocation of Machine-Might

Incantation of the Iron Soul.description: Reduces the morale loss of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Incantation of the Iron Soul.flavor: Raising their voices in binharic praise, the Disciples of the Machine God bolster their spirits with the surety of iron.
modifiers: Incantation of the Iron Soul (1 turn)
Incantation of the Iron Soul.rawXML:
<canticle cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/IncantationOfTheIronSoul" name="AdeptusMechanicus/IncantationOfTheIronSoul" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/IncantationOfTheIronSoul" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/CanticlesOfTheOmnissiah"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/IncantationOfTheIronSoul"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</canticle>
Incantation of the Iron Soul.name: Incantation of the Iron Soul

Bulwark Imperative.description: Increases the armour, but decreases the movement of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Bulwark Imperative.flavor: The warrior wisdom of ancient and experienced Reductors is force-loaded into the Skitarii’s minds. Each thrilling pulse of data locks microactuators into bracing positions, brings reserve power cells online and bestows a sensation of sacred invulnerability upon the Tech-Priests’ soldiers.
Bulwark Imperative.rawXML:
<doctrina cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/BulwarkImperative" name="AdeptusMechanicus/BulwarkImperative" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/BulwarkImperative" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/DoctrinaImperatives"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/BulwarkImperative"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</doctrina>
Bulwark Imperative.name: Bulwark Imperative

Protector Imperative.description: Increases the ranged accuracy, but decreases the melee accuracy of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Protector Imperative.flavor: The Protector imperative is codified to yield the maximum spectra of hard data. Extra power is fed into narrow-band optics and rangefinders connected directly to the Skitarii’s priority programming as the holy warriors’ guns become an extension of themselves.
Protector Imperative.rawXML:
<doctrina cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/ProtectorImperative" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ProtectorImperative" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/ProtectorImperative" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
