			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/DoctrinaImperatives"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ProtectorImperative"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</doctrina>
Protector Imperative.name: Protector Imperative

Conqueror Imperative.description: Increases the melee accuracy, but decreases the ranged accuracy of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Conqueror Imperative.flavor: When the enemy close in, the Tech-Priests controlling each maniple inload Conqueror imperatives that boost the martial subroutines of their Skitarii minions and galvanise them into physical action at the expense of their more elaborate targeting programmes.
Conqueror Imperative.rawXML:
<doctrina cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/ConquerorImperative" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ConquerorImperative" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/ConquerorImperative" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/DoctrinaImperatives"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/ConquerorImperative"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</doctrina>
Conqueror Imperative.name: Conqueror Imperative

Aggressor Imperative.description: Increases the movement, but decreases the armour of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
Aggressor Imperative.flavor: The Skitarii feel the press of an invisible hand upon their minds as the Machine God drives them forward. Servos are pushed to their structural limits as fibre bundles fill with the boundless energy of the Motive Force and propel the faithful on an unstoppable crusade.
Aggressor Imperative.rawXML:
<doctrina cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/AggressorImperative" name="AdeptusMechanicus/AggressorImperative" rankMax="9" requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/AggressorImperative" scaleInfluenceCost="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="4"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="AdeptusMechanicus/DoctrinaImperatives"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="AdeptusMechanicus/AggressorImperative"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</doctrina>
Aggressor Imperative.name: Aggressor Imperative

Mark of Nurgle.description: Mark of Chaos that increases the hitpoints of an allied Chaos infantry unit.
Mark of Nurgle.flavor: Nurgle's blessing manifests not only as a suite of virulent plagues and diseases, but also as the inhuman constitution needed to survive them.
Mark of Nurgle.rawXML:
<markOfNurgle cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="ChaosSpaceMarines"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</markOfNurgle>
Mark of Nurgle.name: Mark of Nurgle

Mark of Khorne.description: Mark of Chaos that increases the attacks of an allied Chaos non-psyker infantry unit.
Mark of Khorne.flavor: The Mark of Khorne is bestowed only upon those whose relentless rage and boundless ferocity pays due homage to the Blood Good's own. To such disciples, Khorne grants an unholy wrath that burns as hot as the stars.
Mark of Khorne.rawXML:
<markOfKhorne cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="ChaosSpaceMarines"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Psyker"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</markOfKhorne>
Mark of Khorne.name: Mark of Khorne

Mark of Slaanesh.description: Mark of Chaos that increases the movement of an allied Chaos infantry unit.
Mark of Slaanesh.flavor: The devotees of Slaanesh have their senses and reactions heightened to a supernatural degree, all the better to drink in the extreme, multifaceted stimuli of the battlefield. A warrior gifted in this manner will move with uncanny grace and speed, his blade lashing out like the tongue of a serpent as he revels in the ugly spectacle of death.
Mark of Slaanesh.rawXML:
<markOfSlaanesh cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<faction name="ChaosSpaceMarines"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</markOfSlaanesh>
Mark of Slaanesh.name: Mark of Slaanesh

Mark of Tzeentch.description: Mark of Chaos that increases the damage reduction of an allied Chaos infantry unit.
Mark of Tzeentch.flavor: Those dedicated to Tzeentch enjoy the protection and prescience of the Master of Manipulation.
Mark of Tzeentch.rawXML:
<markOfTzeentch cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
							<faction name="ChaosSpaceMarines"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</markOfTzeentch>
Mark of Tzeentch.name: Mark of Tzeentch

Icon of Vengeance.description: Icon of Chaos that grants Fearless to a unit with any Mark of Chaos.
Icon of Vengeance.flavor: These icons shine brightly in the Warp, gathering the malefic energies of Chaos to those who bear them and spurring them on to acts of suicidal brabery in their quest to seize victory from the minions of the Corpse-god.
Icon of Vengeance.rawXML:
<iconOfVengeance cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfVengeance" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfVengeance">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne"/>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle"/>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh"/>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Fearless"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</iconOfVengeance>
Icon of Vengeance.name: Icon of Vengeance

Icon of Wrath.description: Icon of Chaos that increases the damage of a unit with Mark of Khorne.
Icon of Wrath.flavor: The red-hot curses of the Blood God resound in the minds of those in the shadow of this icon, compelling them to hurl themselves into the fray with wild abandon.
Icon of Wrath.rawXML:
<iconOfWrath cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfWrath" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfWrath">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfWrath"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfWrath"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</iconOfWrath>
Icon of Wrath.name: Icon of Wrath

Icon of Despair.description: Icon of Chaos that increases the melee damage reduction against fearful enemies to a unit with Mark of Nurgle.
Icon of Despair.flavor: This icon is surrounded by a miasma of disease and hopelessness, turning the thoughts of any nearby foes to the grisly and inevitable deaths that await them.
Icon of Despair.rawXML:
<iconOfDespair cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfDespair" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfDespair">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfDespair"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfDespair"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</iconOfDespair>
Icon of Despair.name: Icon of Despair

Icon of Excess.description: Icon of Chaos that increases the damage reduction of a unit with Mark of Slaanesh.
Icon of Excess.flavor: Depravity hangs about this icon like cloying musk, driving those below it into an orgy of sensation-seeking that can only be halted by the total destruction of their bodies.
Icon of Excess.rawXML:
<iconOfExcess cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfExcess" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfExcess">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh"/>
							<noTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfExcess"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfExcess"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</iconOfExcess>
Icon of Excess.name: Icon of Excess

Icon of Flame.description: Icon of Chaos that grants “attacks deal Soul Blaze damage each turn” to a unit with Mark of Tzeentch.
Icon of Flame.flavor: Coruscating energies surround the icon, swathing the weapons of the devout with mutagenic flames.
Icon of Flame.rawXML:
<iconOfFlame cooldown="1" name="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfFlame" requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfFlame">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<trait name="ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch"/>
							<noTrait name="SoulBlaze"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SoulBlaze"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</iconOfFlame>
Icon of Flame.name: Icon of Flame

Activate Webway Gate.description: Activates and claims a neutral Webway Gate.
Activate Webway Gate.flavor: The Webway was once the backbone of the Aeldari empire—tunnels constructed through the warp in the time of the Old Ones that connected their golden core systems with the Maiden Worlds. Now those core systems are the Chaos-riddled Crone Worlds and the Webway is in pieces—but not on Gladius Prime…
Activate Webway Gate.rawXML:
<activateWebwayGate cooldown="1" name="Eldar/ActivateWebwayGate">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="10"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Eldar/WebwayGateBonus">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-1.0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>	
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<player>
							<faction name="Neutral"/>
						</player>
						<unit>
							<type name="Eldar/WebwayGate"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<changePlayer/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</activateWebwayGate>
Activate Webway Gate.name: Activate Webway Gate

Found Raider Fortress.description:
Founds city on a claimed Webway Gate.

Cities can only be found where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by %2%.
Found Raider Fortress.flavor: It is a tribute to the ancient technologies of the fallen Aeldari empire that what appears to the herd races as a mighty city and fortress is to them a mere stopping point, a temporary haven whilst raiding before they return to the Webway and dark Commorragh.
Found Raider Fortress.rawXML:
<webwayRedoubt cooldown="1" costScalesWithCities="1" name="Drukhari/RaiderFortress" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/RaiderFortress">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="60"/>
						<oreCost base="60"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<affiliate/>
							<type name="Eldar/WebwayGate"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<removeUnit/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<foundCity/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</webwayRedoubt>
Found Raider Fortress.name: Found Raider Fortress

Webway Portal.flavor: By hurling rune-graven orbs into the air, the Drukhari can tear a route into the webway through which more of their kin can pour. Such irruptions of course destabilise spacetime in the vicinity… but the Drukhari don’t care. They aren’t going to be here forever.
Webway Portal.rawXML:
<genericPlayerAbility icon="Units/Drukhari/WebwayPortal" cooldown="3" interfaceSound="Actions/ActivateWebwayGate" name="Drukhari/RaidFromTheWebway">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="60"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Resource"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Drukhari/WebwayPortal"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Summon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericPlayerAbility>
Webway Portal.name: Webway Portal

Archon\u2019s Inspection.description: Soul Hunger ability that increases the ouput of non-headquarters buildings on the target tile.
Archon\u2019s Inspection.flavor: It is not as if the Drukhari’s indentured servants ever slacken in their labours. Yet when an Archon turns his gaze upon them, they labour harder, inhumanly so, knowing that a moment’s displeasure will lead to many lifetimes of impossible torment.
Archon\u2019s Inspection.rawXML:
<archonsInspection icon="Traits/Drukhari/BonusResources" cooldown="10" name="Drukhari/BonusResources" interfaceSound="Interface/BonusResources" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/BonusResources">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="80"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SoulHungerCost">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<affiliatedCity/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="10" name="Drukhari/BonusResources"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</archonsInspection>
Archon\u2019s Inspection.name: Archon’s Inspection

Studies in Agony.description: Soul Hunger ability that makes all Drukhari units grant research when killing enemies.
Studies in Agony.flavor: “Near to death, I hold them. The secrets they whisper. The pleas. Tactics, inventions, knowledge of the other side, revelations… everything spilled. To stop the pain. Why should it stop, though. When it is so… productive.” – Arkanic, Haemonculus to Kabal of The Last Blade
Studies in Agony.rawXML:
<soulHunger icon="Traits/Drukhari/WealthPlunder" cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" name="Drukhari/WealthPlunder" interfaceSound="Interface/WealthPlunder" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/WealthPlunder">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="80"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SoulHungerCost">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="10" name="Drukhari/WealthPlunder"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</soulHunger>
Studies in Agony.name: Studies in Agony

Feast of Torment.description: Soul Hunger ability that grants all Drukhari units the ability to restore hitpoints each turn.
Feast of Torment.flavor: Encouraging the Drukhari to acts of sadism is unnecessary, it comes so naturally to them. However, they still fear their Archon’s wrath, so giving them explicit permission to torture the innocents of Gladius Prime rather than ship them back to Commorragh is sometimes necessary. As a side note, innocent blood has a wonderfully rejuvenating effect.
Feast of Torment.rawXML:
<soulHunger icon="Traits/Drukhari/FeastOfTorment" cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" name="Drukhari/FeastOfTorment" interfaceSound="Interface/FeastOfTorment" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/FeastOfTorment">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="80"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SoulHungerCost">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="10" name="Drukhari/FeastOfTorment"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</soulHunger>
Feast of Torment.name: Feast of Torment

Sacrifice to Khaine.description: Soul Hunger ability that increases the damage of all Drukhari units.
Sacrifice to Khaine.flavor: The Drukhari do not worship the old Aeldari gods or the OId Ones, save for one—Kaela Mensha Khaine, god of murder and war. Only a handful of Drukhari pay fealty to Khaine and most of those are Incubi, the dark mirrors of the Aeldari aspect warriors. Every time they kill with their ritual glaives, it is in praise of Khaine.
Sacrifice to Khaine.rawXML:
<soulHunger icon="Traits/Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaine" cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" name="Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaine" interfaceSound="Interface/SacrificeToKhaine" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaine">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="80"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SoulHungerCost">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="10" name="Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaine"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
		</soulHunger>
Sacrifice to Khaine.name: Sacrifice to Khaine

Soulbread and Circuses.description: Soul Hunger ability that increases the loyalty output of all Raider Fortresses.
Soulbread and Circuses.flavor: In a world so devoid of loyalty, it pays to keep the masses on side—who knows when you will need to drive a lynch mob after your rival, for example? When an Archon pays for a Wych cult to perform in the arena or dispenses food, weapons or victims to the desperate of Commorragh’s undercity, every Drukhari understands that he does it not from compassion, but out of calculation.
Soulbread and Circuses.rawXML:
<soulHunger cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/SoulHungerLoyalty" name="Drukhari/SoulHungerLoyalty" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SoulHungerLoyalty">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="80"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SoulHungerCost">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="10" name="Drukhari/SoulHungerLoyalty"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</soulHunger>
Soulbread and Circuses.name: Soulbread and Circuses

Webway Artillery.description: Soul Hunger ability that damages target enemy unit.
Webway Artillery.flavor: The most powerful Drukhari weapons aren’t light enough to take on a Raid, instead reserved for the defense of the Kabal’s base in Comorroragh or on Battleships for realspace incursions—Phantom Lances and Scythe Missile Launchers and so on. But a wily Archon might allow his minions to fire one of these weapons through a temporary portal, knowing all the while the weapon might be turned on them…
Webway Artillery.rawXML:
<webwayArtillery cooldown="3" durationInSeconds="0.1" name="Drukhari/SoulShelling" interfaceSound="Interface/SoulShelling" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SoulShelling">

			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/SoulHungerCost">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="SoulShelling"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</webwayArtillery>
Webway Artillery.name: Webway Artillery

Soul Tithe.description: Soul Hunger ability that increases the resource output of controlled outposts.
Soul Tithe.flavor: Of course, all Drukhari Kabalites are thoroughly beholden to their Archon and would do nothing to lose their favour… yet, somehow, still, there manages to be a thriving black market in stolen resources, especially further away from the seat of power. So when the order comes in to send their tithes, it’s surprisingly easy to gather enough.

						<addTrait duration="10" name="Drukhari/SoulHungerOutposts"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</soulHunger>
Soul Tithe.name: Soul Tithe

Found Webway Redoubt.description:
Founds city on a claimed Webway Gate.

Cities can only be found where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by %2%.
Found Webway Redoubt.flavor: To preserve the ancient Webway gates on Gladius, the Aeldari know that they must protect them. These rapidly-constructed Redoubts provide some defenses, drawing on the Webway’s limitless power to devastate any enemies foolish enough to venture near.
Found Webway Redoubt.rawXML:
<webwayRedoubt cooldown="1" costScalesWithCities="1" name="Eldar/WebwayRedoubt" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/WebwayRedoubt">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="60"/>
						<oreCost base="60"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<affiliate/>
							<type name="Eldar/WebwayGate"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<removeUnit/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<foundCity/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</webwayRedoubt>
Found Webway Redoubt.name: Found Webway Redoubt

Conviction of Faith.description: Sacred Rite that restores the morale of units with Shield of Faith.
Conviction of Faith.flavor:
“In the age since our disgrace, not one of us has fallen. We do not struggle with our qualms as other do, nor fall to the dark path. Repeat: I know no fear for I am already death.”
  — Canoness Vandire, “The Rite of Conviction” from In Memoriam De Virtute
Conviction of Faith.rawXML:
<tactic cooldown="1" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/ConvictionOfFaith" icon="Actions/SistersOfBattle/ConvictionOfFaith" name="SistersOfBattle/ConvictionOfFaith" requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/ConvictionOfFaith">

					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="10"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/RitualizedCeremonies">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.33"/>
					</effects>

			<conditions>
				<player match="Any">
					<upgrade name="SistersOfBattle/AdditionalSacredRite"/>
					<noTrait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
				</player>
				<player match="Any">
					<noTrait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
					<noTrait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite2"/>
				</player>
			</conditions>
			<unitModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="SistersOfBattle/ShieldOfFaith"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<morale add="2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</unitModifiers>
			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<player>
							<trait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
						</player>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</tactic>
Conviction of Faith.name: Conviction of Faith

Eternal Crusade.description: Sacred Rite that increases the production output of Battle Chapels and Legatines' Priories.
Eternal Crusade.flavor:
“And we shall not rest, for the God-Emperor’s eye is on us. He sees every soul saved and knows that the number imperilled far outweighs it. We cannot stop, we cannot slow—ours is an eternal crusade.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute

Mechanised Wrath.flavor:
“In those last days, the fervour spread. The Rite of Suppliance was performed, to demand the utmost from the Machine Spirits that ran the Manufactora and the Hangars where the ancient war engines were anointed. They did not disappoint.”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

Raging Fervour.description: Sacred Rite that increases the damage of bolt weapons.
Raging Fervour.flavor:
“The weapons in our hands are the instruments of our faith. Each bolt is a prayer sent to the heart of the faithless, spreading its word into their very being.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi

Sacral Vigor.description: Sacred Rite that restores the hitpoints of units with Shield of Faith.
Sacral Vigor.flavor:
“What of these wounds upon us, sisters? Is our flesh that precious to us, our beauty that sacred? Tear at these cuts, open them, they are but motes in fanciful air. Never forget that our reality is faith, and pain, like life, is evanescent…”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute

Chase the Profane.description: Sacred Rite that grants Move Through Cover to infantry units.
Chase the Profane.flavor:
“And the faithful shall be relentless in their inquisition. Nothing shall stand in the way of their will; neither the laws of men nor xenos; not qualms nor friends; not steel nor plascrete nor adamantium.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute

Purifying Recitations.flavor:
“Our foes call us cold, inhuman, unfeeling. But we feel, we mourn, we rage. Let them feel our warmth—in our flamers, our meltas.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi

Ministorum Mobilisation.description: Sacred Rite that increases the requisitions output in cities.
Ministorum Mobilisation.flavor: The rites of the Ecclesiarchy are not merely militaristic: prayers and liturgies exist for all functions of the Imperium. To be the focus of such a rite, whether Famulus or Pronatus or even the most base worker, drives them on to greater efforts.

							<trait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
						</player>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier>

			</actorModifiers>
		</tactic>
Ministorum Mobilisation.name: Ministorum Mobilisation

Vengeful Spirit.description: Sacred Rite that returns damage back to the enemy attacker.
Vengeful Spirit.flavor:
“And in death, we have one last chance—a release from worry. Once dying, there is nothing holding back our fury, no need for self-preservation. We can use up all that we are, take all the blow that come our way, for one last chance at justice.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Vengeful Spirit.rawXML:
<tactic cooldown="1" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/VengefulSpirit" name="SistersOfBattle/VengefulSpirit" requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/VengefulSpirit">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="10"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/RitualizedCeremonies">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.33"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<player match="Any">
					<upgrade name="SistersOfBattle/AdditionalSacredRite"/>
					<noTrait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
				</player>
				<player match="Any">
					<noTrait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
					<noTrait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite2"/>
				</player>
			</conditions>
			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<player>
							<trait name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
						</player>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite2"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>

					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/VengefulSpirit"/>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedSacredRite"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</tactic>
Vengeful Spirit.name: Vengeful Spirit

Deploy City.description:
Operation that deploys the city on the target tile.

Cities can only be deployed where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius.
Deploy City.name: Deploy City

Orbital Scan.description: Operation that reveals the target tile and adjacent tiles.
Orbital Scan.flavor: A Space Marine Chapter commonly possesses an entire fleet of ships, ranging from tiny Thunderhawk Gunships to massive Strike Cruisers. On Gladius Prime, the Chapter fleet was decimated by the warp storm. Only one ship survives, swinging around the planet in a low, erratic orbit. Yet for sufficiently important targets, the Techmarine and Servitor crew will focus all its sensors onto the planet's surface.
Orbital Scan.rawXML:
<orbitalScan cooldown="1" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/OrbitalScan">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1" sighted="0">
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<reveal/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</orbitalScan>
Orbital Scan.name: Orbital Scan

Deploy Tactical Doctrine.description: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Tactical Space Marines.
Deploy Tactical Doctrine.flavor:
“They shall be pure of heart and strong of body, untainted by doubt and unsullied by self-aggrandisement. They will be bright stars on the firmament of battle, Angels of Death whose shining wings bring swift annihilation to the enemies of Man. So it shall be for a thousand times for a thousand years, unto the very end of eternity and the extinction of mortal flesh.”
  — Codex Astartes, by Roboute Guilliman, Primarch of the Ultramarines, Lord Commander and Imperial Regent
Deploy Tactical Doctrine.rawXML:
<tactic cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/Tactic" name="TacticalDoctrine" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/TacticalDoctrine">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="10" name="TacticalDoctrine"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</tactic>
Deploy Tactical Doctrine.name: Deploy Tactical Doctrine

Deploy Assault Doctrine.description: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Assault Space Marines.
Deploy Assault Doctrine.flavor:
“Where there is uncertainty, I shall bring light
Where there is doubt, I shall sow faith.
Where there is shame, I shall point atonement.
Where there is rage, I shall show its course.
My word in the soul shall be as my bolter in the field.”
  — Litany of Devotion, traditional
Deploy Assault Doctrine.rawXML:
<tactic cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/Tactic" name="AssaultDoctrine" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/AssaultDoctrine">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="10" name="AssaultDoctrine"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</tactic>
Deploy Assault Doctrine.name: Deploy Assault Doctrine

Deploy Devastator Doctrine.description: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Devastator Space Marines and Devastator Centurions.
Deploy Devastator Doctrine.flavor:
“Victory often rests on the correct weaponry being in the right place and at the right time. Even the most destructive weapons of war are worthless if absent from the battle.”
  — Artor Amhrad, Chapter Master of the Astral Knights
Deploy Devastator Doctrine.rawXML:
<tactic cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/Tactic" name="DevastatorDoctrine" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/DevastatorDoctrine">

				</modifier>

			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="10" name="DevastatorDoctrine"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</tactic>
Deploy Devastator Doctrine.name: Deploy Devastator Doctrine

Deploy Bolter Drill.description: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of bolt weapons.
Deploy Bolter Drill.flavor:
“I believe in three tenets of battle—firepower, firepower, and more firepower.”
  — Kardan Stronos, Chapter Master of the Iron Hands
Deploy Bolter Drill.rawXML:
<tactic cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/Tactic" name="BolterDrill" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/BolterDrill">

				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</tactic>
Deploy Bolter Drill.name: Deploy Bolter Drill

Deploy The Flesh Is Weak.description: Chapter tactic that increases damage reduction of infantry units.
Deploy The Flesh Is Weak.flavor:
“We have been wounded sorely. Yet still we stand, with fire in our eyes and valour in our hearts. Let them think us beaten. We shall teach them otherwise.”
  — Pedro Kantor, Chapter Master of the Crimson Fists
Deploy The Flesh Is Weak.rawXML:
<tactic cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/Tactic" name="TheFleshIsWeak" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/TheFleshIsWeak">

				</modifier>

				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</tactic>
Deploy The Flesh Is Weak.name: Deploy The Flesh Is Weak

Deploy Machine Empathy.description: Chapter tactic that restores the hitpoints of vehicle and fortification units.
Deploy Machine Empathy.flavor:
“Consider the Predator. Let your soul be armoured with Faith, driven on the tracks of obedience which overcomes all obstacles, and armed with the three great guns of Zeal, Duty and Purity.”
  — Traditional Imperial prayer, source unknown
Deploy Machine Empathy.rawXML:
<tactic cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/Tactic" name="MachineEmpathy" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/MachineEmpathy">

Deploy Machine Empathy.name: Deploy Machine Empathy

Deploy Siege Masters.description: Chapter tactic that increases the damage of units attacking enemy units in cities and fortifications.
Deploy Siege Masters.flavor:
“A fortress circumvented ceases to be an obstacle. A fortress destroyed ceases to be a threat. Do not forget the difference.”
  — Leman Russ, Primarch of the Space Wolves

<tactic cooldown="10" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/Tactic" name="SiegeMasters" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/SiegeMasters">

Convert Auxiliary.description: Converts a unit of Kroot Hounds or Vespid Stingwings to your side. Enslaved units cannot be converted. Cost scales with target strength.
Convert Auxiliary.flavor:
“Soldiers of the Fire Caste! Kroot and Vespid allies! Today, we stand as a bulwark against the selfish, the soulless, and the mad!”
  — Aun'el Shi'ores, at the loss of Kronus
Convert Auxiliary.rawXML:
<convertWildlife cooldown="5" name="Tau/ConvertWildlife">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Enslaved"/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<type name="Neutral/KrootHound"/>
							<type name="Neutral/VespidStingwing"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<changePlayer/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</convertWildlife>
Convert Auxiliary.name: Convert Auxiliary

For The Greater Good.description: Reduces target enemy unit's morale. Cost scales with target strength.
For The Greater Good.flavor:
“There are two kinds of conduct the Ethereals will not countenance. The first is a failure to reflect upon what is for the Greater Good of the T'au race. The second is the deliberate refusal to follow the path of the Greater Good when it is clear what it must be.”
  — Por'ui Dal'yth Ukos, water caste envoy
For The Greater Good.rawXML:
<forTheGreaterGood cooldown="1" name="Tau/ForTheGreaterGood">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Tau/ForTheGreaterGoodBonus">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.33"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<moraleMax greater="0"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<morale max="0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</forTheGreaterGood>
For The Greater Good.name: For The Greater Good

Subvert City.description: Reduces the loyalty of target enemy city. Cost scales with target population.
Subvert City.flavor:
“What’s that? You call that a house!? Someone lives in that?! Oh my. Well, it shows just how brave you all are. Your masters know you don’t need proper shelter or water or food or sleep or rest to die doing your jobs, for the ‘Great Emperator’! If he even exists. Anyway, if you change your mind about joining the T’au, do let me know.”
  — Por'el Dal'kor Slytongue, water caste emissary
Subvert City.rawXML:
<subvertCity cooldown="10" name="Tau/SubvertCity">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<trait name="Headquarters"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="City">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/SubvertCity" duration="10"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</subvertCity>
Subvert City.name: Subvert City

Wisdom Shared.flavor: The Imperium’s technology may be archaic and strange, but the Earth Caste will never cease learning. If the Water Caste can persuade just a handful of Tech-priests to join our cause, their knowledge could supplement ours—could enable even more rapid advances in our technology.
Wisdom Shared.rawXML:
<purchaseResearch cooldown="1" costScalesWithPace="0" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/TradeGoods" name="Tau/PurchaseResearch" requiredUpgrade="Tau/PurchaseResearch">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="80"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<research add="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</purchaseResearch>
Wisdom Shared.name: Wisdom Shared

A Shield For All.flavor: Outside of Imperial oversight, the billion survivors of Gladius may be in constant threat of starvation, death or corruption, but they also have their first ever free time. Bring them to the T’au, and they may spend it scavenging ore and scrap from the fallen hives for you.
A Shield For All.rawXML:
<purchaseOre cooldown="1" costScalesWithPace="0" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/TradeGoods" name="Tau/PurchaseOre" requiredUpgrade="Tau/PurchaseOre">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="80"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<ore add="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</purchaseOre>
A Shield For All.name: A Shield For All

Many Mouths.flavor: The billion survivors of Gladius’ hive cities live hand-to-mouth—but they survive. They dine on scavenged supplies, farmed crops, secret soylent vats, foraged ash clams and hunted canids. Convince them to join the T’au and they will share their feast.

<purchaseFood cooldown="1" costScalesWithPace="0" durationInSeconds="0.1" interfaceSound="Interface/TradeGoods" name="Tau/PurchaseFood" requiredUpgrade="Tau/PurchaseFood">

			</modifiers>
			<playerModifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<food add="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</playerModifiers>
		</purchaseFood>
Many Mouths.name: Many Mouths

Proselytise.description: Increases the population of target allied T'au city.
Proselytise.flavor: Outside in the wastes, live the billion survivors of Gladius Prime. But the T’au doesn’t discriminate against the gue’la—should you persuade them to join, they will surely contribute to our city and save this world.
Proselytise.rawXML:
<purchasePopulation cooldown="1" costScalesWithPace="1" name="Tau/PurchasePopulation" requiredUpgrade="Tau/PurchasePopulation">

								</modifier>

						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</purchasePopulation>
Proselytise.name: Proselytise

Equal Under The Sky.flavor: In the ruins of Gladius Prime, a billion people still live. Though war rages about them, though monstrosities erase their towns, they persist—and those who recognize them, understand them and help them, will receive help in return.

							<allied/>

							<noTrait name="Tau/AdvancedTargetingSystem"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/AdvancedTargetingSystem"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</installSupportSystem>
Install Advanced Targeting System.name: Install Advanced Targeting System

Install Shield Generator.description: Installs support system that increases the damage reduction.
Install Shield Generator.flavor: This generator projects a choesive energy field capable of protecting the bearer from heavy ordnance and anti-tank weapons fire.
Install Shield Generator.rawXML:
<installSupportSystem cooldown="1" name="Tau/ShieldGenerator" requiredUpgrade="Tau/ShieldGenerator">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<supportSystemSlots greater="0"/>
							<noTrait name="Tau/IntegratedShieldGenerator"/>
							<noTrait name="Tau/ShieldGenerator"/>
							<noTrait name="Tau/RiptideShieldGenerator"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>

									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/ShieldGenerator"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</installSupportSystem>
Install Shield Generator.name: Install Shield Generator

Acquire Tile.description: Acquires a new tile for the city. Buildings can only be built on acquired tiles. Each tile has an influence upkeep.
Acquire Tile.name: Acquire Tile

Rapid Rise.flavor: In times of desperation, a Necron Lord can override safety protocols in the reanimation of troops or repair of vehicles, at the cost of heavily increased losses. He will, however, lose support amongst any those of the ruling class who retain sentience, in horror at the waste of resources.
Rapid Rise.name: Rapid Rise

Reclaim Unit.description: Reclaim a Tyranid unit to regain biomass and production at the cost of influence.
Reclaim Unit.flavor: Though the Hive Mind normally only dispatches the worthless swarms of Rippers into its reclamation pools, in extremis it can render down any creature for its resources. On planets conquered by its Genestealer proxies, it's not unusual to see entire assimilated populations and defense platoons marching themselves happily into the digestive pools.
Reclaim Unit.rawXML:
<reclaimUnit cooldown="1" name="Tyranids/ReclaimUnit" interfaceSound="Interface/ReclaimUnit">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost add="10"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Tyranids/Reclamation2">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Tyranids/Reclamation3">
					<effects>
						<cooldown max="0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</reclaimUnit>
Reclaim Unit.name: Reclaim Unit

Acquire Tile (Tyranids).description: Acquires a new tile for the city, consuming its biomass, removing forests and turning the ground into bedrock. Buildings can only be built on acquired tiles. Each tile has an influence upkeep.
Acquire Tile (Tyranids).rawXML:
<acquireTile icon="Actions/AcquireTile" name="Tyranids/AcquireTile">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost add="5"/>
						<biomassCost add="5"/>
						<productionCost add="12"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</acquireTile>
Acquire Tile (Tyranids).name: Acquire Tile (Tyranids)
